author: {'steamid': '76561198089262135', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4348, 'last_played': 1709945732}
review:
Avernum Escape From The Pit is an isometric role playing game developed by Spiderweb Software. A little indie company that has been making RPGs for well over 20 years now. It is a remake of Avernum from 2000, which was a remake of Exile Escape From The Pit from 1995. This review is specifically about the most recent Avernum Escape From The Pit from 2011.

The game takes place in a massive underground cave system called “Avernum”. The world has so much character in the way it was intricately designed. Consisting of multiple regions full of dungeons and settlements, with people that live there with their own philosophies and way of life. Outside of these locations, in the world map, you have tons of winding passage ways and nooks and crannies, and rivers, that can lead to an ambush or treasure or possibly a wandering trader. All of these things are why exploring this world is such a joy along with interacting with the various characters and NPCs that you come across in your travels. You also will often be greeted with very rich and detailed text that will describe any given location or point of interest throughout the world. This helps immerse you further, due to the game’s rather limited visuals not presenting the environments in the same level of detail as can be described in the text blurbs. Even with the amount of text the game presents you, it never feels overly verbose or gets in the way of the pacing through your adventure.

The combat in Avernum is turn-based and pretty straightforward and simple when you get the hang of it, especially compared to D&D and other RPGs with tactical combat. Despite its simplicity it is still fun and very rewarding as you level up and get more powerful spells. There is no level scaling at all in Avernum so if you go into an area that is too high level for you, the enemies will kick your butt. When you come back after hours of adventuring and have gotten new gear, you can really see how far you have come since that last time you encountered those enemies. 
As far as the spells are concerned, they are fine but it does feel like there is something missing. There aren’t really any opportunities to use spells outside of combat aside from the dispel barrier spell. And the negative status effect spells like daze and howl of terror weren’t able to affect most late game enemies due to their high mind resistances. However my two fighters always got affected by daze, charm, and terrify almost every time it was casted on them, but thankfully you get a spell that dispels hostile effects eventually which was incredibly useful.

Pros and cons:

Pros:

[list]
[*]Great world building and a very unique setting for an RPG.
[*]Fun and interesting world map to explore.
[*]Great writing and characters. Well written and descriptive text that describes every dungeon and location you explore.
[*]Simple, easy to learn but satisfying combat.
[*]Multiple endings.
[/list]

Cons:

[list]
[*]Lacking some variety in the spells system. Hardly any utility spells outside of combat and there aren’t enough single enemy damaging spells, most are cone attacks or AOE.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198088133222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3196, 'playtime_at_review': 6176, 'last_played': 1710578096}
review:
그냥 가벼운 게임이라고 생각했는데 100시간이나 해버림.
맵 곳곳을 몇 번이고 훑어가면서 해서 그런 것도 있지만 플탐 50시간은 나올 게임임.

고전겜이라 여러가지 불편한 점이 있는데 가장 불편한 게 아이템 루팅임.
땅에 떨어진 아이템의 모양/색상을 강조하거나 이름을 띄워서 표시해주는 기능이 없어서
아이템이다 싶으면 가까이 가서 G키를 눌러서 그라운드에 템이 떨어져있는지 템창에서 일일이 확인해야함.
그나마 상호작용 가능한 오브젝트를 강조해주는 기능은 있어서 다행인 수준.
본인이 RPG를 할 때 꼼꼼한 성격이 아니다 싶으면 이 겜은 분노를 유발할 테니 안하는 게 나음.

난이도는 처음에는 어렵지만 적응하면 괜찮음.
다만 발게이나 아윈데를 생각하고 덤비면 피똥쌈.
그런 게임들처럼 게임의 중후반을 편하게 풀어가게 해주는 사기적인 아이템이나 마법/어빌리티가 존재하지 않음.

텍스트는 많은 편은 아니지만 한글화가 안되어 있다는 게 단점. 고점겜이고 알려지지 않아서 어쩔 수 없는 부분.
다만 필라스처럼 한글로 읽어도 뭐라고 하는지 못알아 들을 정도로 장황하진 않아서 이 게임에서만 사용되는 일부 용어에만 적응하면 평균적인 영어 실력으로도 문제 없이 할 수 있는 수준.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183406253', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 7353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7353, 'last_played': 1708551643}
review:
Spiderweb Software has been a part of my gaming life since 2005, and it's amazing to see them still keep going and release quality games even to this day. Avernum - Escape from the Pit (remastered version of Avernum 1) has its own unique lore, spells and rules that seperates itself from other well-known RPGs, and is a good starting point if you're looking for a different veteran RPG experience.

Rating: S

author: {'steamid': '76561198068749253', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4393, 'last_played': 1481813532}
review:
[h1] Recommended: Yes[/h1]
[b] Rating: 8.8/10.0[/b]

Summary: I remember Avernum: Escape From The Pit being a great game even though I wrote a review only about 7 years after I completed it. Why exactly it was good, was hard to remember since the last time I touched it was 2016. I remember felt like a good fantasy role playing game, and had lots of interesting towns and places. It had tons of secrets, dungeons, and a lingering feeling of how someone had to get out of the Pit in Avernum, a sprawling, huge underground world. Avernum was an alien world, but it also felt like home at some point.

 

[b] Pros: [/b]
[list]
[*] It has a clear objective, which was to get out of Avernum. That kept me going, I believe. When you do finally think it's finally over, you can still make a choice, which was interesting.
[*] It had secrets leading to the crystal soul series. We can't access crystal soul area, but it was motivating to try out more of Avernum.
[*] It had nice, iconic pixel graphics, reminiscent of the old isometric 3d games. Not too backward, and had nice touch. It has an interesting way to combine 4 people into a single trail of people who walk and fight. Interesting.
[*] It had nice mechanics, with a good touch of magic and skills combined.
[*] It has a good narrative, and a well-balanced lore, not too much, not too little.
[/list]

[b] Cons [/b]
[list]
[*] You might not like this kind of rouge-like rpg games which lacks modern graphics. Settings seem a bit limited now in the world of 2023. Might be a matter of taste though. 
[*] I remember getting stuck a number of times. Difficulty was high especially towards the end.
[*]  [spoiler] Haha, I don't remember a big secret but figuring them out was truely fun. However, good luck figuring them out by yourself [/spoiler] 
[*]  Well if you get stuck you can always use [url=https://www.neoseeker.com/avernum-escape-from-the-pit/faqs/885019-avernum-eftp.html] Avernum walkthroughs [/url]
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198127563354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3730, 'last_played': 1668361226}
review:
Якісна RPG з великим відкритим світом та цікавою історією. 

Ви граєте командою з чотирьох героїв та після невеликого вступу ваша команда починає досліджувати відкритий світ навколо. Й це найцікавіший аспект гри, тому що світ тут велікій та різноманітний, кожна частина містить щось цікаве, це може бути локація, або якийсь квест, або коротка зустріч з якимось персонажем. Тому мандрувати цим світом захоплююче, сама історія та герої роблять цей світ живим.

Бої тут покрокові, але вони досить швидки, та вороги по різному себе ведуть, відчуваєш прокачку команди, взагалі відчуття прогресу в грі - це один із кращих елементів, якщо спочатку ти взагалі не розумієш, що і як та помираєш від кожного бандита, то згодом відчуваєш занурення у світ гри та зростання сили команди.

При цьому через те, що світ гри обмежений в ресурсах - герої теж це відчувають, грошей може бракувати, тому що вони дуже потрібні в грі й це дуже класна частина, адже, на відміну від RPG, гроші тут важливі всю гру.

Графіка у грі проста, але досить зрозуміла, тому на неї перестаєш звертати увагу практично одразу. І якщо графіка здається проблемою, це зовсім не так - так, вона проста, але при цьому показує все, що потрібно.

Загалом чудова гра, яка здатна подарувати багато приємних вечорів тим геймерам, яким цікаво дослідження великого та різноманітного світу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067654596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1706010809}
review: I tried a few times to get into this and other Spiderweb games because of glowing reviews , but i just couldnt seem to,. but then when i actually gave it a real try, wow, i was hooked! The tiny graphics are sometimes annoying when i misplace which hero im actually moving in a fight but the game really is just awesome enough to make you forget. its a huge open world with so much to do, I have no idea where i am in the story but ive got lots of exploring left to do right where i am. So yeah, try it, for real, dont let the old fashioned look turn you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061489975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16023, 'last_played': 1706875880}
review:
This re-remake of Exile, the classic mid 90s shareware RPG that was easily on par with big games at the time like Ultima... it has it all.  It immediately warps you back to the mid 90s. 

The isometric gameplay is crisp and snappy.  The interface has no secrets.  It is peak WYSIWYG, and needs little explanation as you start adventuring.

The game is massive.  Exploring the larger over(under?)world map or any of the towns and dungeons as they gradually reveal themselves is a bit of a lost art form. This game does it perfectly.  It somehow feels modern, standing next to something like Shadowrun, but also feels like something you'd be ordering from a catalog in 1995 via snailmail.

It's a very atmospheric.  The series always had that going for it, and it was not lost in this version.  Exploring the world below the world, uncovering the detailed social structures that have formed from all the other exiles, and fighting different monster tribes is an interesting and rewarding time.  The overall adventure complete with the side-quests available in towns, caves, towers, etc. gives you plenty to do, and you really are generally able to just... go.   You aren't hand held.  You just go.  Start walking.  Get a boat.  Sail around.  Find a cave?  Go see what's there.  Died?  Don't go there for a bit.  Explore elsewhere.  There is always something to find.  There's always some little switch or dirt pile you missed that you can get later. 

The character system is as classic as it gets, allowing you to customize your characters for various melee, missile, and magical playstyles.  The adventuring skills and traits also give a nice tabletop RPG vibe as you need to make sure your party is competent enough to deal with adventuring perils/secrets (cave lore), or be able to read magical scripts found in crypts (arcane lore).   This gives you a great deal of depth without being clunky, overwhelming, or unbalanced. 

The battles are also so tabletop RPG style it's nuts.  It really feels like these games are spiritual successors to the AD&D Goldbox series with the way the grid-based fights play out.   Maneuvering your wizards to shoot cones of lightning around, or strategically knocking enemies back is a really satisfying time.  The battle system is simple, effective, and most of all, fun.

The games addicting.  It gives you that "just a little bit more exploring" itch in your brain that you will be forever scratching.

10/10.   Buy this game, and all the other Spiderweb Software games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014940065', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6070, 'last_played': 1699768074}
review:
I have started and stopped this game more times than I can count over the years.  I would stop normally while being overcome with whatever the opposite of FOMO is.  I’d say to myself that I own tons of AAA games with million dollar budgets and I shouldn’t waste time on this ugly little game.

It turns out that cool graphics, atmospheric music, and voice acting aren’t everything.  A well written story with plenty of choices, the ability to succeed with many different playstyles, and just the right mix of straightforward, but fun design makes for one heck of a gaming experience.  

The game is a bit ugly, but the world is a series of giant caves, so you could argue there likely wouldn't be much beauty there.  There is no music, but if you think about it, Avernum has no music (I literally found one musical instrument in the entire game) and its people are still working on some sort of culture.  I think it kind of makes sense.

It took me years to finally drink the koolaid and stop worrying about my kids looking over my shoulder and judging me for playing this ugly little game.  My 70+ hour playthrough of Avernum was awesome and I can’t wait to dive into Avernum 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561199266776607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4724, 'last_played': 1707868285}
review: Tight game.  Party of 4 adventurers assists in an uprising against authoritarian masters.  Challenging - I've restarted about five times fine tuning my skill points for the upcoming battle.  Reminiscent of some early RPGs such as Ultima IV.  The producer is a great guy too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007364080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 3458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3458, 'last_played': 1651594032}
review:
A basic RPG, Avernum: Escape From the Pit is thus a simple RPG game to play. The combat mechanics are easy to do, and the game world is nice to explore, with the help of a fast-travel system in the later stages of the game.

Other than that, the lack of music and the graphical models of characters and enemies is really a disappointment. Still, a decent game despite these faults.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971599442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1699281862}
review: A classic open map adventure that has me excited to find hidden doors, daunted by clever and powerful foes, and constantly looking to just check one more thing off my list of places to explore and quests to complete. Old school CRPG that just feels good to play today. My only single complaint is the mouse targeting is sometimes finicky. But there always seems to be a keyboard command available when I need precision so it's hardly detrimental to the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036886265', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 9891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3348, 'last_played': 1702665131}
review:
This game is just LUSH. It's pretty amazing how a low-budget indie game of this nature can capture the feeling of an adventure more than most modern lavish productions, such as Witcher 3 & Final Fantasy 16, but it does, by far. 

Everything from the combat, to the character builds, to the writing is crafted and balanced almost perfectly, to provide an incredibly absorbing and exciting experience. There's also a great snappy pace to proceedings too, which really keeps things ticking nicely. 

It's an absolute must-own for any serious RPG fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092623583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3581, 'last_played': 1700506309}
review:
This game is oldscool... the graphics are poor, but functional. The sound is abysmal. But... the story and dialogue are good. No stupid romances, no politics, no intercourse with animals. Just exploration, combat and character development. It is not made for modern audiences... which is great. It is much like a book, a lot of the world is up to your imagination.

It's sad that such small indie games do not have the ressources for localisation, I am happy I understand some english.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988322673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 4700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4700, 'last_played': 1689283337}
review:
Пошаговое классическое партийное РПГ. С точки зрения игрового процесса, игра не предоставляет уникального опыта.
Классов у игровых персонажей нет, прокачивать можно как угодно. Бои обладают некоторыми тактическими элементами, но довольно простыми.
Игровой движок не технологичный. Простенькая графика точно отпугнет большинство игроков.
В игре очень много текстов. Большинство событий и окружающего пространства описывается художественным слогом, что позволяет задействовать воображение, что в определенной степени компенсирует графический примитивизм.
У игры есть свои козырь. Это аутентичный мир, очень атмосферный.
Авернум - это гигантское подземелье, со своей экосистемой. Местная флора - грибы да лишайники. Местная фауна- преимущественно рептилии и насекомые. Некая Империя, крупнейшее жесткое тоталитарное государство человеческой расы, ссылает всех неугодных в Авернум при помощи магии телепортации. Таких ссылочных буквально тысячи, и это не только представители человеческой расы. Империя предполагает, что в этом подземном мире все будут бороться за выживание, и рано или позно перемрут, поэтому о них можно не беспокоиться. Тем не менее, ссылочные научились сносно жить в этом негостепреимном мире, построили множество населенных пунктов по всему Авернуму, и даже создали свое государство (по ходу сюжета выяснится, что даже - не одно).
Представители различных рас преимущественно враждуют друг с другом. Основная раса - человеческая, две другие крупнейшие расы - нефилимы (людокошки) и слитзерикай (людоящеры). Более малочисленные разумные рассы: гоблины, гиганты, разумные паукообразные, гремлины, демоны, драконы и другие.
Игрок управляет новой группой сосланных в Авернум. Цели в игре не ставят, ты исследуешь мир и походу сам решаешь что хочешь делать. По факту в игре есть 3 главных задачи, и даже можно выполнить их сразу все (но только если в определенной последовательности). При этом игра в большей степени линейна, не так уж и много сюжетных развилок.
В игре множество интересных персонажей, особенно удались разной степени безумности волшебники. Вообще магия играет ключевую роль в жизни Авернума. Без магии человечество не выжило бы, ведь именно волшеники придумали способ выращивать питательные грибы, а также воздвигли местные города. С другой стороны, те же волшебники ответственны за нашествия нежити и демонов. Еще удались драконы. Каждый является личностью со своим характером, все из них являются кладезем мудрости (ведь их жизненный опыт составляет века), но при этом имеют свое мнение по поводу взаимодействия с представителями других рас (преимущественно пренебрежительное, а иногда и потребительское).
Авернум очень интересно исследовать (пешком или плавать на лодке). Есть не только множество точек интереса, но и различные случайные или триггерные события, столкновения с периодически появляющимися врагами. В этом подземелье множество секретов и труднодоступных мест, доступ к котором появится не сразу, а только с появлением дополнительных возможностей (навроде артефакта "Сфера Трални", позволяющая совершать короткие перелеты).
Если война с демонами довольна банальна, то вот противостояние с Империей сильно интригует, ведь все встречные персонажи описывают ее как неодолимую могущественную силу. Что удивляет, ведь даже король демонов Гра-Хот их так не пугает. Тем интереснее бросить этой силе вызов.
В целом игра меня порадовала. Увлекательный мир, атмосфера и сюжет с лихвой компенсировали мне все технологические недостатки игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561199442936213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1698953206}

author: {'steamid': '76561198432661169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1696236009}
review: I remember one of my friends mentioning a shareware title called, Exile.  He claimed that it was an incredible CRPG very story driven and full of great turn based strategic combat and it was set in a very unique world.  So, I downloaded the game on my super slow dial-up modem after restarting the download 3 times.  I played it for 2 hours and immediately ordered it so I could get my code to unlock the full game, get my manual, hint book, and 3.5 Floppy copy.  Such a wonderful game with old style graphics, great combat, a deeply atmospheric setting, and the story telling was superb.  I beat the game multiple times and soon followed it up with Crystal Souls, and my favorite, Exile 3: Ruined World.  Avernum is a beefed up version of Exile and it is a gem!  The same story driven game, with deep character customization, excellent graphics and a world setting that I wish they would put to pen and paper.  A DnD campaign set in this world would be something else!  Escape from the pit is the first entry into the series and I can not sing its praises enough.  I have just recently purchased the  Spiderweb Software Bundle so that I can have all of these games in one place.  All of my old copies are obsolete now, anyway.  If you enjoy an obvious labor of love, a deep role-playing experience, great battles, rich, engrossing atmosphere, and did I mention how pretty this game is?  Well, it is lovely and I highly recommend that everyone buy it and support one of the best indie game companies out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3226, 'num_reviews': 1488, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1667838875}
review:
Avernum: Çukurdan Kaçış, oyuncuları uçsuz bucaksız bir yeraltı ülkesinde geçen epik bir yeraltı fantezi macerasına atılmaya davet ediyor. Spiderweb Software tarafından geliştirilen bu bağımsız RPG, karanlık ve canavarlarla dolu bir dünyada hayatta kalma ve zenginlik mücadelesi veren düzenbazlar, uyumsuzlar ve haydutlarla dolu, yeraltının derinliklerindeki bir diyar olan Avernum'da geçiyor. Sürükleyici anlatımı, karmaşık karakterleri ve zengin detaylara sahip oyun dünyasıyla Avernum, kendisine sadık bir takipçi kitlesi kazandıran klasik bir rol yapma deneyimi sunuyor.

Oyun Özellikleri:

    Devasa bir yeraltı ülkesinde geçen epik bir fantastik macera.
    Yüzlerce görev sunan seksen kasaba ve zindandan oluşan devasa bir dünyayı keşfedin.
    Üç ayrı oyun kazanma görevinden birini seçin: güvenlik arayın, kaçışın veya intikam alın.
    Avernum'u diğer fantastik maceralardan ayıran benzersiz ırklar ve ortamlar.
    Yüzlerce yan görevi ve büyülü eseri keşfedin.
    Aralarından seçim yapabileceğiniz 50'den fazla büyü, savaş disiplini ve çeşitli karakter özellikleriyle taktiksel savaşlara katılın.

Avernum: Çukurdan Kaçış'ta oyuncular kendilerini, yüzeydeki dünyayı demir yumrukla yöneten zalim İmparator Hawthorne tarafından yönetilen Avernum'un yeraltı dünyasına sürülmüş olarak bulurlar. Ona karşı gelenler veya planlarına uymayanlar, Avernum'un karanlık, volkanik çukurlarına atılır ve burada açlık, canavarlar veya umutsuzluk nedeniyle ölümleriyle karşılaşmaları beklenir.

Ancak, tüm Avernalılar kaderlerine teslim olmamıştır. Bazıları yeraltının derinliklerinde yeni bir ulus kurarak savaşmayı seçti. Bir oyuncu olarak, onların saflarına katılma, geniş bir oyun dünyasını keşfetme, sayısız göreve çıkma ve büyülü eserleri avlama fırsatına sahipsiniz. Üç farklı oyun kazanma görevinden birini seçebilirsiniz: güvenlik aramak, yeraltından kaçmak veya sizi bu zorlu varoluşa mahkum eden yüzey dünyalılardan intikam almak.

Avernum: Escape From the Pit benzersiz ırklar, ortamlar ve karakterlerle dolu zengin ve sürükleyici bir oyun dünyası sunuyor. Oyunun derin ve stratejik savaş sistemi, çeşitli düşmanlara karşı savaşlarda çok çeşitli taktiksel seçeneklere izin veren 50'den fazla büyü ve savaş disiplini içerir.

Büyüleyici bir hikaye, yüzlerce görev ve keşfedilecek çok sayıda büyülü eser ile Avernum: Escape From the Pit, klasik fantastik macera hayranları için unutulmaz bir rol yapma deneyimi sunuyor. Benzersiz yeraltı ortamı ve ilgi çekici oynanışı, onu bağımsız RPG türünde sevilen bir kült-klasik haline getirdi.

author: {'steamid': '76561199076968770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1689149791}
review:
Lorsque j'avais Windows xp, j'avais acheté la version complète de ce jeu (2d oldshool) et je l'avais adoré. 
J'avais même fini le jeu et acheté la suite. Le gameplay était génial et complet avec plein de trucs a faire et une mechanique de jeu bien équilibré. 
Les graphismes et l'interface était claire et les éléments du jeu bien reconnaissable. 

Aujourd'hui, le remake:
La majorité du gameplay a été charcuté, mutilé et amputé ! Le gameplay et la mechanique du jeu n'a plus rien a voir avec l'original. 
L'interface du jeu très peu lisible et peu contrasté. Les elements du jeu sont minuscule (taille d'une fourmi sur l'ecran) et non reconnaissable. Je vous dit même pas le temps passé a chercher les ennemis, les éléments du décors et les objets au sols. C'est juste injouable et impossible d'identifier un type d'ennemi pour jouer et combattre avec une strategie gagnante. 
Et les combats ne donne plus que des déchets sans valeur et très peu d'argent. Les combats deviennent très rapidement répétitifs et ennuyeux. 

Il y a ÉNORMÉMENT de mauvais choix (lisez les autres commentaires negatifs pour les connaitre) dans le design et le remake de ce jeu et je vais pas tous les cités. 
Le jeu n'a plus rien d'agreable dans ce remake. Il aurait mieux fait de conserver la mechanique du jeu originale, conserver la version 2d en ameliorant les graphismes et de recompiler le tout pour les OS 64 bits moderne et le jeu aurait été excellent. 

J'ai achetée toute la collection Spiderweb software dans un bundle par nostalgie (d'excellents souvenirs avec exile et geneforge) mais au final ces remakes sont tellement mauvais que je regrette l'argent gaspillé. 
Ces remakes m'ont immédiatement frustré, ennuyé et dégouté. 

Si vous possédé les jeux complets originaux, jouez y sur une machine virtuelle, vous y prendrez plus de plaisir que ces remakes ratés parce que la reprogrammation des jeux a été bâclé et non optimisé pour le plaisir et le confort du jeu. 

Si vous chercher bien sur internet vous trouverez PLEIN de jeu GRATUIT OU LOW COST a la baldur's gate, fallout ou plein de jeu complet a la RPG Maker plus agréable a jouer que tout les remakes de spiderweb software. 

Exile / Avernum / Geneforge / etc... sont dépassé par le mauvais choix de reprogrammation et de design. Ils ne valent plus le coups de perdre son temps et son argent avec eux. 

Ils y a plein de jeux gratuit et de meilleurs qualité, de nouveaux mondes, territoires et histoires a découvrir sur internet. Et pourtant je suis un grand fan des jeux retro (je joue beaucoup avec mes vieux jeux sous emulateurs ou machine virtuelle) mais ici il n'y a plus aucune joie, c'est juste une galère.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126849734', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4854, 'last_played': 1686443365}
review:
This game is NEAR PERFECT! Avernum has MANY of the aspects of Baldur's Gate that I LOVE AND very few of the things that I find annoying (limited resources, slow combat, etc.). The story is GREAT, the freedom is FANTASTIC and the game play is very enjoyable even after dozens of hours of play. There are even some great elements that remind me of the early Ultima games. 

This is TRULY a top-notch game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018217471', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 2189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1686406645}
review:
Не знаю за что такие отзывы. Даже рпг составляющая куцая и банальная, а уж про  механики, интерфейс, информативности и удобство игрока и говорить нечего,   30ти летние забытые технологии интерфейса  балдура, дадут фору этому разрабу, не осилившему  даже  нормальный  раздвижной лог сделать.
А уж про баланс  по стоимости заклинаний и их урона это вообще отдельная история. 
И ладно бы одну такую сделал... так нет, сидит как стахановец клепает каждый год по имба саге, все как под копирку... 15 лет прошло, кто нибудь скажите ему, что у  разработчиков новые инструменты появились... уже нейросеть бл... делает лучше и удобней.

author: {'steamid': '76561199149269003', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5000, 'last_played': 1682802300}
review:
Классический рецепт от старины Джефа, волею Неба получивший ремастер. Любителям минималистичных внешне РПГ, где нужно и порядком почитать, и вручную сделанных данжей с пещерками позачищать, и обильно насыпанных секреток разного калибра поразыскивать - строго рекомендуется. Вогель уже давно стал одним из апостолов в среде любителей старошкольных ролевых - минимум графики, максимум сути, и такой милый сердцу ворчливых стариков вайб игр юности, "где жила Старая Магия".
Паучишки, каждый из которых зовётся незатейливым Spider, называющие героев "милыми" и изучающие кунг-фу, чтобы отражать нападки своих злых магических братьев - аранея, заставят любого скептика стать фанбоем. Покупайте, и исследуйте подземный мир занятых номеров в таверне (чертовы караванщики!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198035542647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1693018373}
review: I REALLY enjoy that atmosphere, and way the writing and quest feel like a Table top RPG more so than other TTRPG inspired cRPGs. This game feels more like D&D than baldurs gate or patherfinder wrath of the righteous. It just has that amateur spirit that I adore and eat up. Great game all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993307987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4202, 'last_played': 1682300965}
review:
Classic rpg goodness. The graphics aren't much, and there's no voice acting, but the gameplay is fun, the writing is good, and the game just works. For the fogeys among us, this is a remake of the 1995 shareware game Exile: Escape From the Pit (which is awesome, but getting it to work is a nightmare).

The plot: The Empire controls the whole world. Well, they control the surface. Decades ago, they discovered a one way portal to a series of underground caverns. After a failed expedition, they started using it as a giant prison, throwing in anybody inconvenient, including your party of four adventurers. Maybe you were an actual criminal or rebel, or maybe you were just a malcontent, oddball, or member of a minority religion. The game doesn't say, so it's up to you to decide. It's also up to you to decide if your ultimate goal is to make a new home underground, escape back to the surface, or take revenge on the Empire (or you can do all three, as you can keep adventuring after succeeding).

The gameplay: Pretty standard fare. It's 45 degree isometric square grid. Overworld movement shows your whole party moving in a single square, with some roving encounters, but mostly going between stationary points. Moving around in a location has each character take a square, and they walk in a line. Once combat starts, the game is turn based with your characters moving independently. Skills are also pretty standard. Combat has blades, polearms, ranged, and requisite abilities. Magic is divided into arcane and divine, with the bonus abilities (e.g. extra spell damage) applying to both. There are also a few skills that are neither (e.g. tool use, which lets you pick locks and disable traps). While is sounds like nothing special, it is well executed. 4/5 could use some more polish, but is worth far more than the asking price. 6/5 when weighted against the price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198441605088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 6646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6646, 'last_played': 1682101850}
review:
Во многих обзорах Avernum сравнивают с классическими РПГ старой школы, но я бы дать более конкретное представление о том, что представляет собой игра .
Avernum представляет собой смесь из Скайрима , Fallout 1-2 и Baldurs Gate . От Fallout в игре довольно похожая пошаговая боевая система, от Скайрима сама суть геймплея - свободное исследование пусть небольшого, но насыщенного открытого мира с поиском приключений в нем , ну и от Baldurs Gate - ощущение фентезийной сказки (пусть и мрачной ) с мудрыми королями, могучими героями и сказочными сокровищами .  Но при этом стоит упомянуть, что лучше всего сделана именно исследовательско-приключенческая часть , квесты же и сюжет в целом довольно просто написаны и интересные повороты в них скорее исключение из общего правила . 

Резюмируя , рекомендую игру всем тем , кто готов нырнуть с головой в исследование подземного мира , поиск мощных предметов и интересные битвы с мощными врагами (у многих боссов есть даже сложные и интересные тактики боя) .

author: {'steamid': '76561198115286919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1681998627}
review: Игра восхитительна. Удивляет, что о ней особо никто и не знает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009055774', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 29447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22128, 'last_played': 1681663499}
review:
Hmm, well ... just about recommended.
Interesting mechanics where you can upgrade your individual spells multiple times, and combine your characters abilities, such that their combined knowledge adds up to your party ability in certain areas of ability.

But, there is a huge problem with the difficulty when it comes to combat, at first it seems quite adequate, but the next level of monsters that you can find are a HUGE step up, and you just get slaughtered again and again ... north and south, east and west ... does not matter.

So well yeah, an interesting game, where they, in my opinion, missed a step or two on the difficulty ladder. :).

Edit, well ... it does take plenty of grinding, but it is possible with the right party.
I can only advice : Move into the shade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052272175', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 6473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6473, 'last_played': 1679219455}
review:
[quote] Love RPG? [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39973073/]Make sure to Follow my Curator Page[/url] for plenty more! [/quote]
Avernum: Escape From the Pit is a classic role-playing game that immerses you in a deep and engaging storyline set in a vast and varied game world. Here are some pros and cons:

Pros:
Deep and engaging storyline with multiple side quests and choices.
Large and immersive game world with varied environments and interesting characters.
Well-developed character customization system with plenty of skills and abilities to choose from.
Challenging gameplay with strategic turn-based combat and resource management.
Great value for money with dozens of hours of gameplay.

Cons:
Dated graphics and user interface, which may not appeal to modern gamers.
Steep learning curve for newcomers to the genre, especially in the early game.
Some players may find the game's slow pace and emphasis on exploration and dialogue rather than action to be dull.
Limited voice acting and repetitive sound effects may detract from immersion.
Some players may find the game's punishing difficulty to be frustrating or off-putting.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kjd3Xs1hzqk

author: {'steamid': '76561198386507151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 5536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5536, 'last_played': 1668351211}
review: 冷饭之王Spiderweb。

author: {'steamid': '76561198123445346', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4983, 'last_played': 1709363394}
review:
Редкий случай, когда игра в точности такова, какой покажется на первый взгляд. Дивный гость из страны, где всегда уют девяностых, что греет тёплым пледом тем больше, чем дальше человечество по неосмотрительности уходит в стужу современности. Первая игра в серии. Или одиннадцатая? 

Графика срастается со взором спустя час или два и никогда больше не отвлекает. Ролевая система скудна, но на удивление приятна. Для прохождения придётся запастись своей музыкой или книжками. Есть отличный русификатор, добавляющий багов в игру :) Всё как любили 20 лет назад.
После обучения открыты почти все дороги, а в концах этих дорог подземелья ждут, когда их сокровища рассуют по карманам, тайники и секреты, как влюблённые аниме девочки, делают всё возможное, чтобы вы случайно на них натолкнулись, а финальные задания точат зубы, зная, что вам придётся скрежетать своими дольше, чем хотелось бы — но на то он и финал, причём тройной, как в этих ваших масс эректах, только за выбранный путь поди ещё поборись.
А в города Авернума, наверное, заходим не только чтобы вытряхнуть вышеупомянутые карманы, а потому, что это ещё и интересно. Короткие сценки бытописания, диалоги не без иронии, цели, с каждой из которых соглашаешься. Преступник в игре всегда будет "хитрее чёрта, глупее вороны". Волшебник всегда будет нервным сумасбродом. Злодей всегда будет смеяться над героями и драматично погибать. И в части сюжета, и в части т.н. worldbuilding-а, создания цельной картины мира и заселяющих его людей, Авернум сильно напоминает первые Готики. Все настолько просто, что не может не работать. И работает, и продолжает во 2-й и 3-й частях. В 30-х годах разраб, даст Бог, переиздаст и вторую трилогию, и это одна из немногих вещей, за которые в будущем можно остаться спокойным.

Игры всегда давали только поле для погружения, верить в мир и его персонажей или нет всегда решал игрок. Кому-то проговариваемая мотивация, уникальная физиономия каждого нпс, друзья на всю игру важны так же, как важно современным игрокам количество полигонов у волоса в носу у монстра. Кому-то показалось бы, что недостаёт привычных ныне вариативных диалогов, внутрипартийных шуток или живого окружения. но... в ролёвке старой закалки это было бы даже лишним. Ибо пишется в файле помощи:
[quote=Jeff Vogel]To you, your characters can be living, breathing things, creatures of subtlety and complexity. In your mind, you can give them fascinating personalities, intriguing backstories, and unusual goals.
To the computer, however, your characters are a bunch of numbers.[/quote]
Не будьте компьютерами, друзья. Им это с каждым годом удаётся лучше. А воображение и умение выбрать из 9 картинок грузовик ещё пригодятся.

review: Recommended. It took me about 2 hrs to really mesh with the UI and get into the adventure. I love CRPGs and find the combat and loot grinding in this game is fun. The story so far is decent... and have met a dragon and battled skeletons, goblins, fades, bandits and of course rats! I bought several games in this series and seems like I made the right decision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023275494', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2136, 'last_played': 1657772077}
review: Remake rimejka Exile. Dla niezaznajomionych to w latach 90tych wyszedł Exile 1 który kilka lat później dostał reamke Avernum 1 który znów kilka lat później dostał kolejnego remake'a  a więc ową wersję Arcanum. Jakby nie patrzeć A1 to już klasyk i gra kultowa w dość wąskich kręgach rpgowyvch zapaleńców a szkoda. Świat Avernum jest wspaniały, całę opisy, zadania i wydarzenia robią wspaniały klimat. Gra jak i cała seria ( i jeszcze Geneforge i Queens Wish) są robione praktycznie przez jedną osobę.

Avernum: Escape From The Pit è uno di quei giochi che non possono definirsi per tutti. Con una grafica ed un’interfaccia entrambe datate, fa della storia di fondo e delle sfaccettature correlate la sua forza. Il titolo è sicuramente consigliato per chi apprezza il genere, mentre per i giocatori cresciuti con interfacce più moderne l’incontro potrebbe essere ostico. Considerando che la saga ideata da Spiderweb è composta da tre remake (dei sei capitoli inizialmente pubblicati), doveste appassionarvi alla storia troverete tantissimo pane per i vostri denti.

 Voto: 7.5

author: {'steamid': '76561197994611322', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9839, 'last_played': 1687840659}
review:
A little more simple spell wise than other RPGs like baldurs gate, but that ends up making the game very solid at its core. A large interesting world to explore, small secrets to uncover (hidden levers and the like), good combat and great story. I played this game to completion, and now am hunting the last few achievements.

9/10 Missing a little of the secret sauce of a 10/10, but I keep coming back for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972581643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16970, 'last_played': 1670899136}
review:
A re-re-make of the oldskool indie RPG, "Exile." Although principally the work of just one man, Avernum displays all the design aptitude of much more prominent isometric RPGs, and though this particular set of remakes came out in the 2010's, they bare many of the more endearing characteristics from PC design in the late 90's. If you're looking for a comparison, I would say the original Fallout is probably Avernum's closest (well-known) cousin.

Like many such games, you're going to be reading your way through the game, but the writing is generally well-crafted and illustrious, good-humored enough to stay amusing, and succinct enough not to grow overly tedious. The game hits a sweet spot for non-linearity: there is a real sense of progression as you expand the range of your travels into yet more hostile lands, but it feels very much like the emergent result of how the world fits together rather than a clumsy dictate. This quality underpins the primary gameplay loop of exploration, conversation, and hard fighting, which tends to cycle at a satisfactory pace. I offer praise for difficulty settings- "torment" difficulty offers a very fair challenge for a well-informed player with a good party-building plan and a willingness to play some dirty tricks against the game systems, where "hard" should offers approximately the same deal to a player who is astute but coming in blind- just as long as you're not TOO impulsive, you should be able to carry on through a long-term mistake or two. The developer's attitude is such that there is one very specific cheat code that will undo one very specific mistake that can keep you from attaining one of the three game-winning conditions, but you should be able to avoid even the need for that by just minding your manners.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550311', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4480, 'last_played': 1670844293}
review:
"Epic" seems like an understatement for this series.

So much to see, so much to explore.  Open world, and except for increasingly dangerous foes, nothing to stop you from doing things in the order you want to.  You can't get stuck, there are only a few game-ending choices (all plot-driven).

What a world!  Many towns.  Many dungeons.  A lot of seemingly empty land between, with special encounters peppered throughout.

It's a very old-school RPG with limited stats and improvement options, although what is there is interesting enough.  One downside to the open-world concept is the amount of backtracking involved to tie up loose ends.  There is a quick travel option, of sorts, but it still leaves a lot to be desired.

Buy it on sale, then wait until you can dedicate 70+ hours to a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024921971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3623, 'last_played': 1671827488}
review:
Behind the crude graphics is a hardcore RPG with excellent combat and fine writing.  The UI is well thought out and the game loads FAST.  You will find yourself enjoying it more than the blockbusters that cost millions to produce and have all the soul of a hollywood blockbuster.

This is a fun and clever adventure with lots of well-balanced tactical turn-based combat -- 60 hours of play so far, and I am not sure where the ending is, but I am really enjoying it.

I bet it would be really good on the Steam Deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088582309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3719, 'last_played': 1669398597}

bardzo fajne i do bólu klasyczne RPG. Niestety historia mnie nie porwała. Brak większych zwrotów akcji. Wkurza bardzo upierdliwy system szybkich teleportów i słaba lista questów - często nie wiadomo gdzie się zgłosić,żeby domknąć zadanie. 
Mimo wad, grę polecam. Wciąga!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996794629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5059, 'last_played': 1709855852}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995753880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1669142417}
review:
Об игре узнал, когда прочитал Мать учения. Автор книги сказал, что вдохновлялся миром авернума.
 Действительно есть сходства. Магия, как минимум.
Интересный сеттинг гигантской пещеры. Простой, но не глупый сюжет. 
Интерфейс на удивление удобный, хотя привыкать к нему пришлось долго. В современных играх на хоткеях экономят, а тут ими можно почти всё.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023561405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3061, 'last_played': 1669785761}
review: It's definitely old school and not for everyone, some quests can take a long time, combat is turn based, and the story develops slowly and the game itself can be a grind.  That said, I still enjoy it as I love playing these types of games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105058204', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 3334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3334, 'last_played': 1668647274}
review:
[h1] Going underground. [/h1]

Некая Империя держит население в стальных тисках. Раньше уничтожала всех врагов империи, но позже решила ссылать их в подземелье - гигантскую сеть пещер под названием Авернум. Среди врагов империи затесалась и компания героев под управлением игрока. И перед ним становится задача: отомстить Империи, обезопасить Авернум и вернуться на поверхность. 

Под управлением игрока оказывается команда из четырёх персонажей. Игра позволит настроить каждого на своё усмотрение - выбрать ему профессию (воин, жрец, волшебник и тому подобное) или же создать что-нибудь своё. Однако это вовсе не значит, что у нас получится создать абсолютно неповторимого бойца - прокачка тут довольно примитивная. При повышении уровня на персонажа выдают по одному очку атрибутов, по два очка навыков, также раз в несколько уровней выдаётся по одному очку способностей. И лучше все качать воинам-танкам силу и выносливость, а магам - интеллект. В навыках немного поинтересней - четыре "школы" боя (мечи, копья, луки, метательное) и две школы магии - по одной на магов и на жрецов. Также есть специальные навыки - "владение инструментами" (совмещающий в себе обезвреживание ловушек и взлом замков); "знание пещер" (позволяет вовремя замечать ловушки и тайники); "знание тёмных искусств" (наши маги-жрецы так научатся читать встречаемые талмуды с заклинаниями). Лично у меня бегала команда из мечника (благо в игре есть пара великолепных мечей), лучника, мага и жреца. И чувствовал я себя вполне комфортно. 

Авернум - это не просто сеть пещер. Это довольно большая карта. В ней несколько мирных городов и множество мест, где наш отряд с удовольствием отправят на обед. Населяют Авернум не только люди, но и несколько других видов живых существ. Бестиарий тут занятный - от людей, нежити до драконов. Откуда тут города? Сперва эти пещеры населяли другие хозяева, потом Империя отправила сюда экспедицию, вооружённую особыми артефактами (их потом наш отряд сможет найти и использовать), во в качестве ссыльных частенько сюда отправляли не просто бандитов, но и строителей, магов и прочих профессионалов. 

Игровой процесс состоит из изучения Авернума, выполнения различных заданий и пошаговых боёв. Как я уже сказал, здесь несколько городов, где можно набрать задания (всякого мусора а-ля, "убей 20 ящериц" тут нет. Самое близкое - убить десяток летучих мышей обернётся... другим приключением. А бои, за счёт неплохого бестиария порой занимают немало времени. Всевозможный лут, который накапливается за время путешествий тут можно складировать в бездонный, общий для каждого члена команды, мешок, из которого потом можно одним кликом мышки всё продать. Несколько цепочек заданий выдаются противоборствующими фракциями, что немного добавляет вариативности. 

Но это игра не без недостатков.
Во-первых, тут очень мелкий интерфейс - особенно это вызывает неудобство при поиске кладов или скрытых кнопок. 
Во-вторых, проблема русификатора. Очень качественная работа лежит в руководствах. Перевели блестяще, однако этот перевод немного нарушил работу игры и в ряде моментов она может вылетать. Решается это возвращением на язык оригинала. Файлы сохранения не ломаются. 
В-третьих, игра старомодная - читать придётся очень много. Если читать не любите - проходите мимо.

Я с удовольствием провёл эти часы в Авернуме. В ближайшее время, надеюсь, смогу обратить своё внимание и на продолжения этой игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963960442', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2439, 'last_played': 1669659054}
review: Not an amazing game with enthralling mechanics or anything, but definitely worth the less than $10 I paid for it, and a decent little game to push around when you want to put in low effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001593238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2120, 'last_played': 1668208509}
review: Incredibly satisfying exploration, story, and tactical combat. This is a must have for anyone who is a fan of Ultima or Final Fantasy. I see common threads from both with a unique take in delivery. The graphics and sound are dated, but that is the only part of the game I would deem less than amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067188057', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1675192251}
review:
Juego de fantasia medieval por turnos. La historia, la cantidad de personajes, misiones, looteo,... Según he leido, tiene más de 100 horas de juego; es increible la cantidad de contenido que trae este clásico.

Por lo que se este remastered del primer avernum es el unico que se ha traducido al español; por lo que merece la pena comprarlo y si te gusta ya luego comprar las siguientes entregas. Mucho más atrapante que muchos juegos de su género con más renombre

author: {'steamid': '76561198008723078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4556, 'last_played': 1686743606}
review:
Don't get fooled by the graphics or by the overly simplistic pitch, you're in for a long epic adventure.

At first, the insane quantity of text and old school gameplay put me off a little bit. But after a few hours in, I just couldn't quit this game, exploring every tiny bit of the map and learning more about this world. The writing ended up being really good, with lots of interesting NPCs and subplots.  Many places feel unique despite the assets being similar (the writing really makes up for it) and lots of dungeons provide interesting ideas and challenges.

It took me around 65 hours to finish this game and I strongly recommend it to any crpg fan out there

author: {'steamid': '76561198011482695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7137, 'last_played': 1667241597}
review: I've played these games since I found it on a shareware compilation disk in the late 90s, and every time around I'm surprised at how fun it is. There is just enough new to keep me coming back. It does feel a little more streamlined with each iteration. If you haven't played any of these games before, you're in for a treat. Don't obsess over min-maxing, just enjoy the unique, detailed, and sometimes goofy world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431793692', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1696343445}
review:
Avernum is a game i had previously somehow never heard of (i didn't grow up on videogames) but feels like a damn shame not to catch up on. It's very alike the first Fallout games, but it is more accessible for people who have no prior experience in the retro RPG category.

Avernum is a surprisingly open world with many quests for multiple safeholds and towns scattered across the underground world of, well, Avernum. You play as a quartet of people whose roles you can alter at the start of the game- (priest, mage, etc), and have multiple ways of levelling up and picking attributes for every one of your characters separately throughout. The only goal really, is to get the hell out of this place, and the game leaves you many options on what else to do. You can be peaceful, you can be evil (if you're strong enough to beat the towns and safeholds of course) and you can be neutral if you please, or be a mixture of everything, i won't tell.

overall, a product of its time yet altered enough in the remake to not feel as horribly punishing, cunfusing and crunchy like a lot of the RPG games released in and around the nineties.

author: {'steamid': '76561199162709334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1695763919}
review: great story good alternative to book reading

author: {'steamid': '76561198009626836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 734, 'playtime_at_review': 3240, 'last_played': 1710197438}
review: Relive the good old days of computer RPGs. Very fun, and brings back lots of great memories. Can you do better then you did before? Try again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063797852', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1686880524}
review:
Anyone who is into older non-RPGs, this is the game for you. This is one where you start-out with a diverse party of four: Fighter, Rebel (Rogue-like), Priest, and Mage. You are exiled from civilization from the get-go and must survive in the world-below-the-surface. 

There is a lot of reading, of course. Gamers complain about a game having no story, then complain about having to read too much. I would rather read a lot and have a decent story. The English is very good, thankfully! I'm tired of dealing with games, where someone on the team thinks their English is great, but it just isn't.

There are dialog choices, but I'm not sure that they hugely affect game-play. Thus my statement that it is a non-RPG. This is from the era when games were billed as RPG, but were not actual Role-Play Games, like most of the games on the market today. A true RPG has you build a character and play true to that character. At least here, you are not doing power-builds.

There is a level system, and you find items that will make your character more powerful. I do not know if items have level limits. I have not yet seen evidence that they do. 

This is a turn-based system, which I frankly like. I don't like the chaos of real-time battle.

This one introduces the races that you will be able to play in sequels. In this one, they are your enemy, along with the Empire, which is a heavy-handed dictatorship. They threw you into the world-below-the-surface.

I may update this as I go. The game is paused, hence the notice above that I have played for 0 minutes. LOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198085665052', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1700308425}
review: PЗа 50 рублей,получил неплохую пошаговую рпг.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016706011', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1670226345}
review: I used to play the shareware copies of the Exile series as a kid in the late 90s/early 00s. I never understood what the hell I was doing or how to be any good at the game, but it reminded me of an RPG my dad showed me on our DOS computer in the mid 90s, so I always wanted to play it. i'm glad that they've released these versions as they allow me to relive those shareware days that I remember so fondly, and now that I'm older i recognize them for the wonderful RPGs that they are. the concept of exile as an escape from oppression also intrigued me as a young person that felt like I couldn't be myself in the state i lived in, and the underground setting always seemed so cool to me. all in all, i'm quite glad that Spiderweb is still around to pass games like these onto a new generation of players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148574462', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1479678850}
review: Tedious and generally unfun, this is a game that's completely banking in on nostalgia and not doing it too well/

author: {'steamid': '76561197965740181', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 3390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3390, 'last_played': 1666315696}
review: Fantastic old school CRPG - story is there, but mostly world building and feels very much like a D&D campaign, combat is interesting and diverse but has plenty of weird jank (both beneficial and frustrating), and there are plenty of groan worthy quests that are such a pain to get through, but never make you want to stop playing for some reason. Worth checking out if you're a fan of old school turn based dungeon slogging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148676717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1666059055}
review: Ugly. Big. Requires a lot of reading. And it is isomorphic turn based game with clunky controls. So this game won't be for everyone. But if you like the fantasy genre, exploration, and loot, this game can be bought for cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044441632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2412, 'last_played': 1667607529}
review:
What can be said that isn't painfully obvious?

Avernum: Escape from the Pit. A remake of a remake of Exile: Escape from the Pit, which I can only assume was a pretty solid game back in the day. I enjoyed the original remake (Avernum I) well enough. That is to say it was clunky, poorly balanced, and devoid of direction. But for its many faults, it was still quaint, nostalgic, and diverting.

That is not the case with this rendition. Somehow, Vogel managed to take his clunky, unbalanced design, and make both of those aspects immeasurably worse. For example, tell me how it is that 98% of your enemies (which always outnumber your party) can, with every basic attack, manage to hit multiple party members, and/or cause one or more debuffs that prevent any action at all for at least one turn. Meanwhile, when you do manage to get an attack in, it misses half the time, no matter how much combat skill your character has. Furthermore, best I can tell, the additional clunkiness was caused exclusively to add some half-assed animations, for the additional cost of graphical detail and distinctiveness (presumably because such features would be more effort to animate). The result is just remarkably bland. Certainly not worth the remake.

If you're curious about this game, my best recommendation is to not waste your resources, and instead go with an earlier rendition for cheaper. GOG.com makes it easy.

Will I finish this game? Probably. Through countless tedious, frustrating hours, I probably will. But only out of sheer obnoxious stubbornness and utter self-loathing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109333132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4499, 'last_played': 1664624793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009573440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16226, 'last_played': 1663545523}
review: I love this game. Yeah it's kinda ugly and the sounds are basic--and Spiderweb gets every millimeter of mileage out of these assets. Truly fantastic environmental storytelling as well as writing. I wish Vogel had a AAA budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034668227', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 4608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4609, 'last_played': 1618801945}
review: Generally if you like one Spiderweb game you'll like the rest. Good RPGs in the classical sense, without feeling dated. I enjoy them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054515463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1604345658}
review: I grew up playing the old Exile series shareware games on Mac and the fact that remakes exist makes me so happy

author: {'steamid': '76561198124984158', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 4676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3350, 'last_played': 1663460538}
review:
Pretty good! Feels very weird to play, though. There's no real gameplay "loop" as far as quests go past the basic dungeon crawling loop, because the longest questline in the game is 5 quests long, and exploration of new areas happens extremely quickly with only 2 or 3 major roadblocks throughout the game. Because of this, a lot of the game involves figuring out which quest you want to complete out of the dozens of unrelated odd-jobs you've picked up. Oftentimes i find myself having to [i]force[/i] myself to keep playing and go into yet another dungeon. The story is pretty nonstandard and not very satisfying, and the character writing is [i]generally[/i] pretty nothing (with some interesting exceptions).

That all being said, whenever I do force myself to play the game, I find myself having fun feeling rewarded with a very elegant (albeit a little scattered) difficulty curve where there's always something on your level or lower to fight. The combat system is relatively sturdy, rewarding good strategy and planning, although it does feel slow and a little awkward, especially before you unlock group healing spells. tl;dr it's pretty good but just play Geneforge

author: {'steamid': '76561198863756214', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 2933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2845, 'last_played': 1662071188}
review:
Авернум-мир куда отправляют всех неугодных Империи и не важно какое преступление ты совершил тяжкое или просто обычная бытовуха.
Мир Авернума это огромнейшая пещера в которой есть замки,форты,фермы,пещеры,зато в этом мире нет лучей солнца,но человек привыкает ко всему))
И вот четверо героев отправляются в пожизненную ссылку в этот «дивный» мир….Приключение начинается!
Сюжет.
Квесты в игре просто потрясающие ,меня засосало конкретно !
Поначалу сюжет не ясен,но чем дальше заходим тем все больше и больше проясняется.
Лор игры насыщенный просто огроменный
Геймплей.
Игра представляют собой классическую пошаговую рпг,где в нашем распоряжении четыре перса,стандартные классы,интересная прокачка,много лута!
Графодрочерам тут делать нечего,здесь решает лор и геймплей !
Звук.
В игре нет озвучки,зато есть тонны текста. 
Русификация в руководстве игры.
Звуки в игре атмосферные,погружение максимальное!
Что не понравилось:
- Есть квесты которые взял сначала понезнанке ,но потом пошел по альтернативному пути (выбрал другую сторону лагеря) он остается в журнале,не удобно !
- Некоторые квесты то ли я запорол то ли игра,не пройти потому что на месте нет человека который должен быть там,благо это второстепенные задания
Не думал что смогу осилить эту игру,но я смог ! Остался доволен от прохождение и знакомства ! Советую

author: {'steamid': '76561199160743147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1664672118}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007145712', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5291, 'last_played': 1661202407}
review:
It took 2 tries to get into and commit to this behemoth of a game. The controls are clunky, the graphics are dated, and the balancing of battles will have you frequently switching between normal and hard. But if you can look past the rough edges, you'll find a gem of a compelling and novel story, interesting characters, and an underground world that'll reward you for exploring every nook and cranny. 
8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989794323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1660797872}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123322860', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1662452593}
review: This is a decently engaging classic RPG. It's got a lot of detail without being overwhelming, and enough choices for a good variety of things without needing too much thinking. There is plenty of humour and fun references woven through it. Of course I know where my towel is! I like the way the party moves together as a unit. Except for my sorceress who has a bad habit of going the long way around when it's her turn to fight. Pathing is not her strong suit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031897812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4476, 'last_played': 1660170064}
review: Sehr empfehlenswertes oldschooliges Rollenspiel. Wer des englischen mächtig ist darf sich auf einen angenehmen Schreibsil und eine tolle Story freuen. Das Spielprinzip ist fesselnd. Bei mehr als 300 spielen in der Bibo hab ich mir dieses zum durchspielen ausgesucht...und die Nachfolger geleistet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970625486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5124, 'last_played': 1659490581}
review:
Overall I thought this game was a solid turn-based RPG.  It has reasonable writing (nothing blew me away but nothing made me groan either) and decent combat and progression systems.  The in-game economy was always relevant - I felt like I didn't have enough money to buy everything I wanted(there are plenty of ways to sink money into additional character upgrades) but I had enough to pick and choose between some useful upgrades.

The game does not do much hand-holding with the order in which you should tackle things - it is possible to get into fights which are too hard for you at current character levels (esp. on harder difficulty).  I think this is mostly a good thing - it allows more freeform exploration, but worth noting.  (Especially that end-boss-of-dungeon fights can be significantly harder than the fights to clear the rest of the dungeons)

The soft level cap(character progression slows significantly after level 30) was tuned pretty well - at the end of the game 3/4 characters were at soft cap, so it was about right. 

Keyboard support is pretty good - not so much for movement, but being able to cast spells and target enemies with the keyboard was much appreciated instead of having to use the mouse for everything.

Cons:
I thought the game was a little too long.  I played 85 hours - some of that was having to load a saved game and try a tough fight again (or possibly more than twice), but some of it felt like pointless combat padding (especially some of the later dungeons where only the end boss was actually difficult and the fights on the way got tiresome - I'll make an exception for one VERY late dungeon where this was put to good effect)

It was very difficult sometimes to select squares in combat for movement if the space was crowded - the cursor tended to want to select an enemy/character instead of the empty square, and since action points and movement can really matter this was occasionally very irritating.

I mentioned keyboard support being good, one limitation to that is that I wish the keyboard shortcuts for enemies were more stable (when targeting a spell on an enemy you can type a letter 'a', 'b', etc but a new enemy moving into view can reorder everything - so if you're trying to play a bit faster it's very easy to end up targeting something you didn't intend because the enemy that was 'b' last turn isn't 'b' anymore.  The interface _does_ show you what it is, the update is just irksome)


I would have preferred a game about 33% shorter (so more like 60 hours for me).

author: {'steamid': '76561198014290127', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2501, 'last_played': 1666338478}
