author: {'steamid': '76561198066202043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2414, 'last_played': 1510868010}
review:
Difficult to recommend/not recommend. I'd say more like 50/50. It's not an easy title to review. I appreciate the fact it's a small team game, but it seriously retards your progress sometimes. The setting is good. In fact, a lot of the tripple A titles can only wish for a world setting that is as interesting as Avernum's. Writing is ok; again, it's a lot of text for a small team and it shows. While you can follow the CLEAR directions given to you and still explore with abandon, oftentimes the writing falls just a centimeter short of a tropey throw-away. The saving grace here being that it is when you're dealing with the side quests. There is an interesting and challanging monster variety. Character progression is good. My tank feels like a tank, my mage is not terribly squishy. Things USUALLY agro the first character that charges at them(that helps you immensely when you play). Combat is not too repetitive and sometimes requires unique approach for bosses. There are some solid consumables to play with.   

It's lacking some quality of life elements that can make the game a lot better--UI organization, interaction with the environment. Ease of accesss stuff, so to speak. More shortcut spaces. Easier periphery organisation for the player. A plethora of small stuff, that was perhaps overlooked. Combat balance and difficulty spikes are all over the place. But I guess people would form their own opinion about that. A good deal of misses, even for characters who have invested in dexterity and skills. Mobs can have too much resistances and too high of an evasion, or too high damage and easy spammable abilities that do too many things at once. It can get downright frustrating at times. Consumables can massively alter the direction of combat(can be good/bad). Bullet sponges also make an appearance. Sometimes that is alright. Sometimes it feels inapropiate (a shaman that is ridiculously overpowered). Sometimes it feels boring (especially when it happens with every boss mob that is also showering you with poison in a tight nephelim fortress, which leads you to overconsume potions). Sometimes it feel great and done right, for instance, fighting a giant for which you get a specific side quest and he is a real challange with a really good reward. It's a lot of hit and miss with this game. There is a lot of content to go through and I just get the feeling that in the making of this game there wasn't enough thought about which is going to be good/bad. There are things like pacing between conversation and combat, exploration, main story, side quests. Avernum somehow manages to strike a balance in that regard. But it doesn't feel like it was because somebody wanted it.

The game as a whole is not bad. I suppose you should play it on it's easiest/normal setting. But who wants to do that? It needs polish; balance polish. 50/50. I am truly in the middle, despite the tag. And I will play through the whole of it, because I am an RPG nerd. For my kind Avernum is a must. And for you, too, if you're one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084832546', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1630882105}
review: Rundenbasiert ist für mich ein Schachbrettkampfsystem wie in Avernum - gibt es leider viel zu selten. Die Geschichte ist sehr interessant (obwohl meine Englischkenntnisse nicht ganz ausreichen), die Welt nicht riesig aber groß genug, um viel Zeit mit Entdecken und Erforschen zu verbringen und :) man kann nutzlose Sachen einsammeln, wenn man will: Löffel, Teller, Eimer, Steine, etc. (die sind nutzlos, oder?) Das Spiel ist sehr einfach gehalten und man findet sich schnell zurecht, trotzdem gibt es viel Charakterentwicklung. Wahrscheinlich schaue ich mir die anderen Teile auch an.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972622346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1509894095}

author: {'steamid': '76561198151645322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1537781909}
review:
我其实是第一次接触这样传统的D&D Crpg，这个游戏深深的吸引了我。捅过阅读文本和想象脑补所形成的感觉，是目前来说任何画面超强的游戏都很难做到的。这个感觉非常立体周全，我需要举一个例子。
在游戏中很快的，玩家就会接到一个要求清理解决鬼怪骚扰的任务，前往一个名叫Spiral  Pit的场景。游戏会通过一些非常简单的音效，让玩家迅速感觉到：嗯，这地方闹鬼。接下来一段文本出现，描述了这个洞穴于Avernum普遍环境的区别：“……区别于外面广泛而弥曼的闷热和硫磺味儿，螺旋洞内的空气干净却又寒冷。这种是一种异常的寒冷，让人不禁警觉这个地方背后邪恶法术。……”
接下来的一段时间里，玩家需要不停的在一条宽度只能通过一个单位的狭窄走廊中探索前进，不时的需要解决前后夹击的敌人。——这真是巧妙的关卡空间设计，它带来的压迫感，配合之前的文本，确实让我紧张了起来。
接下来，很突然的，洞穴里全都黑了，文本跳出来告诉我：“忽然之间，一切陷入了黑暗之中，你几乎什么也都看不清楚了。”我赶紧打开背包把蜡烛点上，它只能照亮小队成员们周围三格的范围。你能看见在有限的空间里有几个尸鬼和幽灵，而周围红色的格子告诉你在黑暗中还隐藏着更多。它们向你冲过来。
在这一关的最后，也就是螺旋洞的中心，会跳出一个本文，讲述了这个洞穴遭到死灵占据的原因：“一瞬之间，你眼前浮现了一场环境。那是在很久之前，一些身着古旧铠甲的战士们遭到蜥蜴族的追击被迫逃难至此，却发现螺旋的隧道将他们引入了死路。蜥蜴族族虐杀了他们。战士中随团的法师在临死之际将洞穴封住，这让蜥蜴族的暴徒们也无法脱身。被肢解的战士们，他们的怨灵不愿离去，牢牢盘踞在这个洞中。等你清醒过来，你意识到即便是消灭了亡灵的头目，你也无法彻底清楚这里的诅咒。”之后是一场BOSS战，亡灵的头目不停的召唤身边的怨灵从周边的围墙中涌现对你们进行围攻，当然这也是通过文本的方式表达的。
嗯，相信这些分享会让大家能够更多的了解这个奇妙的游戏。这个游戏给了我一些人生上的指引——画面太好的RPG我特么不想玩儿。

author: {'steamid': '76561198188887257', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1517768110}
review:
Очень достойный проект. Игра вышла на свет в 1995 году под именем "Exile I: Escape from the Pit", в 2000 её переиздали под маркой "Avernum". А в 2012 она наконец явилась в полной красе с похорошевшей графикой, и новым движком.

Если сравнивать с гигантами RPG того времени, как Icewind Dale, и Baldur's Gate. То можно получить неутешительные выводы. Авернум хорошая игра, со своим шармом и необычными фишками, одна из них - огромная карта наполненная секретами снизу и доверху.

Но диалоги... они отвратительны. Обычно мы постигаем мир с помощью текста. Диалогов, найденных записок, случайных текстовых событий. В Авернуме со всем этим небогато. Там дают минимум информации, и все диалоги максимум упрощены. Ни тебе отыгрыша роли, ни многообразия ответов, лишь скудная линейная связка, от которой никуда не деться. 

На дворе 2012 год, обновленный движок это замечательно. Но черт побери, как насчёт нормального ИНТЕРФЕЙСА?
Он настолько куцый и неудобный, что просто оторопь берёт. Зайдя в какую-нибудь вкладку, из неё не выйти простым нажатием клавиши, нееет, с помощью мышки мы должны нажать на галочку, которая и закроет вкладку. Это же просто свинство. Особенно это мешает, когда не хочется всматриваться в пиксели предметов которые разбросаны по карте, и каждую минуту вызывая окно которое показывает вещи на земле, закрывать его приходится галочкой!

Но атмосфера стоит того, чтобы закрыть глаза на подобные недочёты. Хоть и не в полную силу, но она затягивает нас в Авернум, с которой сложно расстаться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014740076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2934, 'last_played': 1499393230}
review: One of my favorite games. Played through it multiple times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062488600', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1549558644}
review:
A great remake of an epic classic isometric RPG (Exile). Fluid gameplay, storyrich dialogs, beautiful escenarios old school style and a simple turn based combat system, makes this work one of the best of the genre. If you enjoy classic isometric RPGs, such as Ultima series or Summoning, you are going to enjoy a lot this fantasy epic. 

Walking across the huge Avernus cave systems is like follow the trails of dark elf Drizzt Do'Urden thorugh his path to exile.
 
Absolutely recommended, even at regular price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001218597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1702763131}
review:
I first encountered a shareware demo of Exile on a cd-rom packaged with one of the first issues of a magazine called Mac Addict when the only computers I had access to were an aging Commodore 64 and my parents' Mac Quadras. While my friends with Windows were playing Warcraft and Command and Conquer, I fell into the world beneath the Empire.

There's a reason Jeff and Mariann have retold this story 3 times now. It's a good one, and the formula doesn't need much updating. I still recognize all the sound effects from that first shareware demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036418239', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4679, 'last_played': 1530009808}
review:
PRO:
+Tante missioni 
+Tante aree da esplorare 
+Ambientazione interessante
+La difficoltà normale è difficile il giusto
+Artwork molto curati 
+Tanto da leggere

CONTRO:
-Grafica spartana
-Non è sempre chiaro cosa bisogna fare per avanzare
-Una sola canzone che viene riprodotta solo nel menu principale e i finali
-Solo in inglese

''Avernum: Escape From the Pit'' è il secondo remake di un gioco chiamato Exile, ma lo migliora con una nuova veste grafica (che non fa gridare al miracolo ma non è nemmeno inguardabile) e lo rende compatibile con i nuovi sistemi operativi. Avernum non è un gioco di difficile comprensione come un vecchio ''Fallout'' o un ''Bards Tale'' visto che si viene accolti da un dungeon introduttivo molto facile che vi spiega tutto quello che potete fare nel titolo, ma non è nemmeno in modalità autoplay come molti ''RPG'' moderni perchè mantiene alcune caratteristiche molto old school. Ad esempio la necessità di andare da un trainer per migliorare le proprie abilità. Dovrete tenere a mente l'ubicazione di chi vi ha dato la quest e a che punto della quest siete per evitare di fare giri a vuoto perchè è vero che molte quest sono indicate sulla mappa di gioco, ma il diario non verrà aggiornato. In realtà non è così difficile ricordare i vari indizi grazie alla presenza di un apposito pulsante record che copia l'intero pezzo di dialogo nel vostro diario. Insomma se non ve ne frega nulla di una grafica spettacolare, ma volete solo giocare un RPG con tante cose da fare compratelo a occhi chiusi. Di solito lo si trova a 2-3 € insomma è praticamente regalato per quello che offre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093592209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9383, 'last_played': 1653620727}
review:
After more than 170hrs of playing, I still think game is great. But I see 3 very annoying things, from which you'll be suffering all the game.
1. Broken random hit chance. For example, game log shows 95% hit chance on current foe, and you can easily miss 4 times in a row! And this is without items with negative hit chance. 95%? I'm not so sure. In some battles it means you just lost and have to load last save.
2. Wards and cloaks you have to update in every city. So annoying. What was the reason to drop it in every friendly location?
3. It's almost impossible to click (in some cases really not possible) on the free cell during the fight in case if that cell located above, to the left or to the right from the foe or your hero. There are only 2 or 3 pixels which you need to find and click to move your hero properly. And if you miss clicked that 3 pixels, wow, you should load previous save. Could be easily fixed, but was not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122498392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1634835351}
review:
Classic DnD like game made by people who respect the genre.
You can almost feel the inspirations behind this game.
I recommend it to any old school/table top fan.

Very fun to "Oregon Trail" it - Name them after friends, family members, co-workers, and let the adventure begin!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136645486', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7432, 'last_played': 1504461036}
review:
Awesome game! A great example of gameplay over graphics and the story is great too! 
The only downside is the UI that takes some getting used to but that shouldn't take too long. 
If you like CRPG style games with a turn based battle system and don't care much for graphics then you should check this game out for sure!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098282099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1692706620}

author: {'steamid': '76561198336778126', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1660018940}
review:
An ancient milestone in RPG adventures, so monolithic it still stands tall today.

When I was the tiniest of children, I was introduced to a series of party-based adventure stories - rich in character and consequence - called Exile. These games instilled in me a great appreciation for video games that try to create and simulate an actual world, alive with a beating populace for whom one could feel genuinely acquainted.

Twenty years later, after decades of wondering where those games went and why there are so many series that use the word 'Exile', I discovered that Spiderweb Software are alive and well, still developing and still destributing the Exile series.

Sadly, that series cannot be run on modern operating systems. I should restate... it would be sad - if Spiderweb hadn't taken the time to update said games and make them available once more.

Full and oddyssean, not just for the time but even compared to some modern games, Avernum is a highly enjoyable and suprisingly replayable Fantasy classic dealing with the ever-poignant themes of loss, fear, struggle, unity and the determination of the living to do just that.

I cannot describe my elation, at the continued existence of this universe. I strongly recommend this and any other Spiderweb RPGs to anyone who misses the simple complexity of the classic RPG format, or of pure, analogical storytelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998115486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 6488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1685432536}

Definitely no Baldur's gate,  but for the price its worth spending a while in

author: {'steamid': '76561198024971526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1657920989}
review: I first played this game back in the Nineties, when it was still called Exile: Escape From the Pit. It's one of those traditional Western cRPGs that's very much in the style made so playable by games like Baldur's Gate. While it doesn't quite have the same amount of polish as that classic, it's still a fantastic game with a lot of depth to it (and a new setting, so you're just as unfamiliar with the locations as the characters). I love it, and I think if you're into Western RPGs you'll love it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980443136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 23012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20974, 'last_played': 1495214891}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198068208518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4310, 'last_played': 1498050730}
review:
YES. HOLY JEEZ YES.

I am so glad I bought this amazing thing. Don't let the graphics trick you into thinking this is a cheap, low-quality game--its not.

The only thing just to be ready for is the interface is quite unlike any other game (at least that I've played) and as such gameplay will probably be clunky and it takes a few hours to really get the hang of it. If you give it it a chance, you will struggle to put the game down after the 3ish hours or so.
(that was about how long it took for me to start having fun with the combat--again at first the mechanics/controls are difficult so fighting is a pain in the behind but after you can actually do things in an orderly manner it gets fun rather quickly)

Noteworthy Stuff:

Very compelling story. Quite original, quests make sense and have meaning, and because the writing is so good you'll actually want to read all the dialogue. Tons of secrets, things to learn about the very big world.

Challenging/Rewarding gameplay. Hard when it should be, not just to be a nuisance for fighting every single monster. When you get to stop some terrible thing from happening it feels really good.

FREEDOM TO EXPLORE: This game doesn't treat you like a baby. Very big world, no invisible walls, no "you cannot enter this area yet" garbage. The toughness of the monsters will keep you from an area if you're not ready for it. There are many many places to explore, interesting pieces of Avernums past and other secrets to learn.

Just go and buy the thing already. Have fun. I wish I'd known about this game/series years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060045566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1680289388}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979329728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 8971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8804, 'last_played': 1496466380}
review:
I great role playing game where you command a group of four characters in the enormous cave system known as Avernum.

There are plenty of quests to complete in the game, from simple delivering a message to slaying a strong group of monsters in a small cave.  Most of the towns do have unique shops in them, like one may have someone who can train a combat skill whereas another sells boats needed to reach another area.
The game does lack a bit in puzzles to solve to progress.  It plays a bit heavily toward hack'n slash as most battles in the game are normally kill the monsters to win.  Some battles may be more difficult to overcome and require more tact to succeed.  For example, your group can position yourself to fight in a doorway so you only fight one monster at a time, which is the best way to win because you are likely to get killed when the rest of the monsters pummel your weaker support characters.
Although it is possible to search out different areas of the game from the start, it does play a bit more linear because going to those other areas can possible get your party killed as the monsters that roam different parts of the game tend to be more powerful than what your party can handle.  So usually when someone in town suggests you go some place to see if you can help them, it is best to just go that way.
The game does suffer from some nuisances.  The biggest for me was the battles.  Sometimes it is difficult to cast an attack spell because when you attempt to focus on which grids it will affect, your party members or the enemy characters will interfere with your placement.  Sometimes I was unable to get the targeting grid to set in position to attack as many hostiles as I would like because it kept jumping to different spots, so I may cast a Lightning Spell only to hit three of the five enemy targets I wanted to hit.  
Another issue with the battles is the inability to know if your spell will target the enemy (or ally) or not.  If someone was to cast a group heal spell, there would be no way to know if one party member was out of range of the spell until it was cast.  If an enemy position him/herself against a cave wall in a certain way, it is difficult to spot if its grid is targeted to not.  
If there was a way to make characters transparant for targeting with spells and make the characters a spell will affect give a glow or maybe change color to indicate the spell is in their range, it would help alleviate these problems.
These may seem like a big issue in the game but it really does not break the game at all.  Just small nuisance for a great game to check out.  
I thoroughly enjoyed exploring in the game, discovering a new underground cave system to uncover new weapons and armor, new towns, and hidden treasure in some random corner on the over (under) world map.
I highly recommend this game to those who enjoy a more traditional role playing game with text to read to get a feel of the world.  If you need voice acting and animated clips in your role playing games, you will be not care for this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201454201', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1558295557}

Bug出现了，在走某个迷宫（不知道是不是此地区专有bug所以不查名字了）去upper area的时候走出了地图？？？在地图外边游走？？？

2022/8/17

author: {'steamid': '76561197986301871', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1699514588}
review: Having completed the game already long before I purchased it here, I can say with surety that this is a pretty impressive game. I really enjoyed it and the story, plus the turn-based combat is nice and gradually increases in difficulty as you progress through the game, turning into quite a strategic affair. The lack of cutscenes and voice acting really appeals to me, as I read so much faster than speaking and I find those unskippable 'cinematic' aspects of modern games to be boring and stupid. If you can't read you are dumb. As per usual, I'm thoroughly impressed with Spiderweb Software. This game is one of my favourites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045373464', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1677294101}
review:
The Avernum original trilogy are my absolute favorite RPGs of all time. Extremely good story driven game combined with open world from the start lets you pretty much do what you want. It has turn based combat and very simplistic graphics and no music beyond a couple small jingles you get (one at the game menu and the other during loading screens). Each game in this series will easily last you 80 to 100 hours each. The game lets you create a party of 4 characters at the start of the game. The characters have no discernable personality but that makes them easier to project yourself onto.

All in all, you will not be disappointed with this game. Number 2 is also available on steam. Number 3 hasn't been remade yet. If you want to buy the original remake from the early 2000s you can get all 6 avernum games on GoG for under 10 bucks.

ps: I only have about 40 hours on this game at the time of review, but I have played through the 2nd version of this game before, which is not available on steam. This version has some really good quality of life improvements like a quest log, free resting and resurrection of dead party members, as well as an easier to understand skill system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046877319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1504060776}
review:
Simply addicted to this game now, it scratches that itch that makes you want to keep exploring to discover new locations, hunt for rare, valuable equipment, encounter new NPCs to give you more quests, etc. Visuals aren't groundbreaking but the story is well written and gameplay is strong. Turn based combat works well and goes fast. 

Only a few complaints: buying/seling can be a pain, and you have to restart the dialogue with an npc to sell things off multiple party members, there doesn't seem to be a way to organize or clean up inventory items, and text is super small. I can hardly read the names on the map! 

This game is an RPG in many ways except for the fact that, funnily enough, there's no role-playing. Your characters have no personality that you can shape by your choices and hardly any in the first place. Play instead for the exploration, questing, and challenging combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033745431', 'num_games_owned': 2853, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 4132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1666420541}
review: Ultra-classic open world CRPG set in an underworld prison where magic and mayhem abounds. This is Jeff Vogel of Spiderweb Software at his absolute best once again, crafting a huge, seamless world with unique and fascinating lore, interesting characters and exotic detailed locations. Dozens of hours of very high quality gameplay makes this is a must-play RPG if you're into the isometric and old-school types of RPGs. Enjoy! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060519527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 5057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4376, 'last_played': 1495144871}
review:
If you loved the feeling of exploring a new world in Fallout 1 and 2 and wish you could find more games like those, I highly recommend trying this one out.

Cons:
 - It has much, much less variation in the graphics than in Fallout 1/2.
 - Smaller towns (with less dialogue in each town) than in Fallout 1/2.
 - The towns' characters have less personality than in Fallout 1/2.
 - Parts of the world are gated until you've become powerful enough to get through some certain areas, so it isn't possible to stumble upon the most-powerful enemies in the game, the way you can in Fallout (which can be extremely frustrating but can also produce memorable experiences if you manage to escape alive).

Pros: 
 - There are many, many more towns and dungeons than in Fallout 1/2.
 - The creator did an incredible job of setting the difficulty curve of the game.  Throughout my entire 80 hours playing it, I found myself hitting this sweet spot of difficulty where I needed to focus during a fight or I would die, but if I *did* focus, I would almost always emerge victorious.


Just different:
 - The writing doesn't have the humor of Fallout 2.
 - You control a party of people (4 in my case).

review:
Adictivo, completo e inmenso. Muy buen trabajo de guión, [i]quests[/i] y ambientación. Totalmente recomendable teniendo en cuenta el estilo [i]old school[/i] en los juegos de rol occidentales de los años 90.

El único "pero" que se le puede sacar es que los textos vengan totalmente en inglés, ya que basa toda su ambientación en su vasto y descriptivo guión.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086875229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1483991307}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993153906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7167, 'last_played': 1496439575}
review:
130h pour arriver à terminer l'une des 3 intrigues principales mais quel plaisir !
Fans de CRPG, je ne peux que vous recommander cette pepite !

Alors certe, il faut remplir quelques conditions :
- être très bon en anglais : l'histoire est touffue et les textes utilisent un vocabulaire fouillé
- avoir des attentes très modestes concernant la réalisation graphique et sonore
- aimer les combats tactiques complexes au tour par tour
- aimer les RPG "medieval fantastique" avec des histoires profondes

Si vous avez répondu "oui" aux 4 conditions ci-dessous, alors allez y...foncez !
Vous ne serrez pas deçu, on contraire. 

Ce jeu risque même de vous surprendre sous bien des abords :
- son ambiance oppressente et des personnages fouillés
- Grâce à son monde ouvert et cohérent : Vous n'avez pas le niveau pour visiter l'antre du dragon Anthron, pas de soucis...10 autres endroits sont à explorer à votre niveau, dans n'importe quel ordre
- la variété des ses quêtes
...

Et le plus formidable, c'est que l'on ait 15 minutes ou 3 heures devant nous, il y a tjrs qq chose à faire dans Avernum !
Reste plus qu'à attaquer le 2 !

author: {'steamid': '76561197988392568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 17731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17305, 'last_played': 1491769388}
review:
This is one of those games that I keep coming back. It has a very compelling (so far) story, a reasonably complex character building. And is wholly turn based, so you can keep out for 3 hours and forget to turn the game off, what probably justifies the big game hours that I have.
I have never finished the game. Not that I ever finish a game: I've never finished Oblivion, Skyrim, Morrowind...

The good:

Clever rogue-like x tactical turn-based combat ;
Interesting development choices for your characters: there are no "classes" in the normal sense. I currently have a party of a tank priest, tank mage, a spearman and a swordsman, both starting in the healing arts, now.

Open game: Playing on the average difficulty, there are places where I still do not dare to go in the game. Oh, and it is an open-game: want to go all the way down to the pits of doom? Be my guest, and good luck : you will need a lot of it and lots of reloads, but it is possible...

Compelling and well told story. You are thrown into a subterranean world by an evil emperor, and that happens to be the fate of every other human thrown there... If you wink the wrong may, say something you wouldn't, you will end up here. When you get there you find an struggling, evolving society, based on the growth of magical fungus and trees. ANd not without their power struggles: there are the catlike nephilim, also thrown here by hawthorne, and the native (?) slithzerikai, lizard men native to the place... And the avernites are at war with both. Not mentioning the abyss, where the most dangerous criminals are exiled from avernum itself... All this is told you by clever character dialogs (text based), where you feel the despair of the inhabitants, some of the depression, craziness...  And there is no way out (or is there)?


The bad: 

The user interface is annoying: I had to manually edit many of the stock sprite screens to be able to identify objects that I can pick up (made the sprites have green stars when they are pickable). There are many objects that are not obvious containers (a bonfire, a dead body, a pile of skulls), yet they are... The map is isometric, and the walls are all opaque, making for situations where you simply can't find an object to interact with. 
The inventory screen doesn't show your armor and protection levels, making you bounce back and forth between the inventory and character sheet. Inventory . Esc. Character sheet . esc. inventory... 
The map is made of elevated isometric tiles: this can make the identification of where in the grid a foe is on the combat screen difficult some times... And you can't target properly area of effect spells... sometimes the characters get literally in the way of the actual square where you want to center a spell. 
Other times, this same visualization issues can make you target a square that is out of range , making you lose a turn by accident. Oh, and the keys for attack and shoot are the exact same: you switch them with the s key. Making you try a melee combat when you want to shoot, and vice-versa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042954807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1507997429}
review:
Only just discovered this series and Spiderweb this month....Guess I've been out of loop all these years. Amazingly under-rated gem. If your a fan of classic crpgs like BG this game is for you. For the price you'll easily get your moneys worth and then some. 

I plan to do a full review once I complete the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277158792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 5553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5553, 'last_played': 1490710213}
review:
Just finished the game. Did two of it's three ways to win it (after I won it on one I just needed more of it, don't want to explain this because I may spoil you).

Here are some impressions on the game that can support my recommendation...

This is the first time I play turn based RPG, and this game easily gets me into the sub-genre:

+
Excellent combat.
Difficulty settings balanced.
Very good story. Unpredictive. Emotional.
Unique world, engine, atmo.
Nice skill tree and character developement.
Payed attention to details.
Overpayed attention to details.
Huge open world
Exploration.
Enough lore.
3 ways to win the game (can do multiple endings, I did 2)

+/-
4 members party to lead. (I liked this)

-
Game doesn't explain itself enough at some points, This can lead to being totally stuck with nowhere to go, but to the internet. I admit I did this horrible, cowardly thing twice to win the game on alternate ending :( I didn't have to use help to win it first time tho.

Overally, I really recommend Avernum, for it's full price. Especially for cRPG lovers who already played Baldur's Gate, IW Dale, Planescape, Neverwinter nights and Pillars of Eternity. 

I don't recomend it to people who don't have patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980795128', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3454, 'last_played': 1366182000}
review: Janky old-style RPG with a heart of gold. Unique storyline and evocative pixel-art. Just be prepared to battle through awkward UI and dated systems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027473826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2337, 'last_played': 1489357460}
review:
I learned of the Avernum series back when the original Avernum 1 was new. It quickly swept me away with its huge open world and freeform exploration. In addition, the world of Avernum is both unique and well-developed. This was all just from the demo as I was never able to get the full game until it was released years later on GOG. Escape From the Pit is a revamped remake of Avernum, and it takes the game to the next level. I'm looking forward to getting Crystal Souls!

If you're looking for fancy graphics and intense special effects, this may not be for you. To me, the visuals are excellent as I love the isometric style. However the true excellence of the Avernum series, as with all of the games made by Spiderweb Software, is the depth of the story and the excitement of free exploration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054730834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1489681326}
review:
JOgo parece ser bom historia profunda
mas o layout dele não me agradou, gráficos pobres, sistema estranho, pouca customização
infelizmente os pontos acima não me permitiram ir mais a fundo no ambiente do jogo

author: {'steamid': '76561198122878553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 4685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1502485033}
review: A gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314530059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3901, 'last_played': 1524163040}
review: Jeff Vogel's games are not for everybody and if they are not for you...I get it.  They appeal to a small population of mostly older gamers (30+) who spent their childhood in the 80s and early 90s playing old-school computer RPGs that looked and played similar to these games.  For younger people who were introduced to RPGs through something like Final Fantasy 7-15 or Oblivion or something like that, it's hard to recommend this because you probably won't be impressed without your nostalgia glasses on.  For those of us that played games like DnD Goldbox games or Might and Magic or Ultima, these games are a very fun time in familiar territory with great writing that inspires your imagination to fill in the blanks the graphics leave open.  I personally love the combat system which is turn based but also grid based which gives it an extra layer of strategy.  Not only is it important to plan out which skill to attack with, but also where on the board you are attacking from or what area to cast a spell at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060470937', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1523777484}
review:
..I got this game cheap on a sale.  It looked like an old-school/tactical rpg blend (I didn't know it wasn't a new indie game) and thought "the whole game takes place in a cave, that might be cool."
..I'm here to say it is cool.
..This is one of the few rpgs that actually make you feel "This place is really interesting, I need to know more."  At the same time, the writing does a great job of telling a story without making you read a novel.  
..There are random encounters that each feel unique.  Sometimes the enemies will flee and you can choose to cut them down or not.  Some goblins took up camp near a town.  I came up planning on killing them, but the game said they were poor and sad looking and that they didn't seem to be causing any harm.  I let them be and they're still there as far as I know.
..many of the mechanics are very unique (such as shared stats for things such as lockpicking).  The whole team's mechanical ability is taken into account.  Also secrets are hidden behind skills arcane lore and cave lore (also party cumulative).
..Now I'm not through with the game, or even super deep into it, but (and this never happens) I haven't found one bit that annoys me or gets in the way of the fun. 
..I highly recommend this to any fans of old school rpgs, and anyone who wants to explore a unique and interesting world.  Wait for a sale if you have to, but (knowing what I know now) I would have paid full price.
..PS there's like four sequels!  So even more waits if you like the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002124849', 'num_games_owned': 2059, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1708028801}
review:
Pretty sure most people know what they're getting into by now with Spiderweb games.

This is a remake of a remake, a turn-based, party RPG with an open world, tons of quests, and a legitimately interesting world and story.

It's not going to change your life, but it will pass the time pleasantly to be sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059119906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3713, 'last_played': 1349420400}
review: Holy crap. This game's narrative is amazing, so if you're into oldschool games, buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063589453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1638849902}
review:
i give this game a 9 out of 10 for multiple reasons. i love it

1) it has awesome grid-based turn-based combat with characters that have unique skills and character traits
2) the game is well-paced, meaning it doesn't just throw you into a hole you can't get out of, but neither does it let you rofl stomp on all of the enemies
3) the graphics are dated but that doesn't really matter
4) the story is pretty cool and engaging
5) the interactions with the NPCs are awesome
6) it has steam cloud!

just one word of advice -- i recommend doing all of the quests for each town before moving onto the next. unfortunately i'm actually currently stuck on my first playthrough because i'm at a point where the game is too difficult for me to play.

i think i went through the quests too quickly and possibly didn't complete them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089621246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5722, 'last_played': 1486508981}
review:
Well worth the money, even when not on sale... if it's your kind of game.  Reminds me of a lot of Ultima with an occasional feeling of Might and Magic.

Update:  The amount of quality content in this game is overwhelming, difficulty is very well balanced (on normal difficulty at least), and the writing is exceptional.  If you love RPG's, you just cannot go wrong with this title.  It is very apparent this was a labor of love by someone who commands a gift for creativity and attention to detail.

Epilogue:  I got an insane amount of playtime out of this for the price.  The game continued to impress and satisfy.  I should have paced myself better, because towards the end I just felt exhausted.  The writing and story-telling maintained their high quality all the way through the end(s), which I found to be quite fulfilling.  Now I realize this was a remake of an older title, and there are more than a few additional Spiderweb titles.  Not sure how I missed it when I was younger.  I guess I was preoccupied with one of my nasty ex'es or just in a gaming burnout phase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025196500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1485725539}
review: The concept is solid and the old school feel is right.  If you get this at a discount and want to try it for a few dollars, sure.  But as a game that isn't just fan made and shared amongst friends, but is sold commercially, with all due respect: (1) the game mechanics are too simplistic for its release date; (2) the plot and quests lack depth and there are glaring issues that detract from a player's ability to immerse himself in the game; (3) the interface is incredibly clumsy, and there is a lot of trial and error necessary to understand how certain items operate, which in the heat of battle is not great; (4) the writing is not as good as people say it is-it's not bad for English as a second language, but it doesn't stack up against its peers; and (5) the dialogue trees are terribly frustrating: you will find yourself having the same circular conversation for ages before you can actually hand in your quests or trigger new ones, and sometimes it's just a matter of mashing the text options at random until you can finally finish the dialogue and advance the plot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010139574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3321, 'last_played': 1483382706}
review: Wann hast Du zuletzt ein Spiel durchgespielt? Bei mir war es Escape from the pit. Das Spiel ansich ist uralt und genauso auch im Appstore erhältlich. Trotzdem hat es mich hier gefesselt. Tolle Welt, puristisch und trotzdem wie früher: Rundenbasierte Schlachten, gar nicht so einfache Quests, die mich sehr an Dinge erinnern vor 20 Jahren: Überhaupt nicht linear, teilweise schlechte Tipps und definitiv keine Fragezeichen über den Köpfen der Questgeber. Mal wieder Zeit mit dem Laufen quer über die Karte verbringen? Hier kein Problem? An einer Quest verzweifeln, weil der Hinweis im Questlog zu kurz ist? Liefert Spiderweb alles mit. Für mich genau das Richtige und deswegen 4/5 Sternen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027083562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6542, 'last_played': 1651433217}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028488055', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4435, 'last_played': 1513947935}
review:
Como el tesoro que se encuentra escondido en un rincón que se abre al accionar un mecanismo al final de la guarida del dragón, Avernum: Escape From The Pit es una auténtica joya oculta. Un juego indie, escasamente conocido por el gran público, que debería ocupar un lugar en la biblioteca de cualquier amante de los juegos de rol. Un RPG de corte clásico que a pesar de no brillar por sus gráficos, contiene elementos que lo pueden posicionar entre los grandes del género.

Pros:
-La historia es de lo mejor que he visto en un juego de estas características. La ambientación de Avernum, un mundo subterráneo donde son exiliados los malhechores y enemigos del Imperio, es absolutamente sublime. Los detalles ocultos, la información sobre la Primera Expedición, el emperador/tirano, demonios encarcelados, armas destruidas que podrás volver a forjar, personajes que te cuentan las razones que les han llevado hasta allí… Todo ello, por supuesto, conlleva horas y horas de lectura y paciencia para disfrutar de todo lo que ha sucedido y sucede a tu alrededor, construyendo un relato a la altura de la mejor novela de fantasía épica.

-Jugabilidad excelente. Unas mecánicas que te llevarán a probar distintas estrategias en combate, con un nivel de exigencia extremo que te hará echar mano de cada hechizo, poción, pergamino, varita mágica u objeto que tengas en tu inventario. El combate por turnos está muy bien logrado y te hará repetir una y otra vez algunos encuentros clave para intentar salir con vida.

-Buenas horas de juego. Aunque Spiderweb especifique humildemente en la capturas de la tienda de Steam que este título tiene 30+ horas de juego, si veis las que me ha llevado completarlo os daréis cuenta de que da para mucho más. Las misiones secundarias son numerosas, pero aun sin completarlas todas, la historia principal te mantendrá pegado al ordenador una buena temporada.

-Creo que es la mejor inversión que he hecho en mi vida en lo que a calidad/precio se refiere. Avernum: Escape From The Pit me costó 1,25€ y me ha dado más de 80 horas de juego. Me ha gustado tanto el trabajo de Spiderweb que inmediatamente me he lanzado a comprar toda la saga. Este que analizo aquí, más Avernum 2: Crystal Souls, más la trilogía Avernum 4-6, me han costado en total menos de 6€. Epic win.

Contras:
-Gráficos y animaciones mejorables. Personalmente esto no ha repercutido lo más mínimo para disfrutar al máximo de este juego, pero creo que es de recibo avisar al personal. En cualquier caso, las capturas de pantalla de la tienda hablan por sí solas.

-El seguimiento de las misiones se hace un tanto tedioso. En ningún caso se actualizan cuando cumples algunos objetivos y hay veces que ni siquiera se marcan en el mapa. Esto por supuesto le da un plus de dificultad al juego que a mí (llamadme masoca) me ha gustado. He tenido que anotar a mano en un folio algunos datos. Entiendo que pueda haber gente que no esté dispuesta a pasar por ahí, pero en mi caso me he acercado más si cabe a una experiencia rolera total. Debo decir que también he tenido que consultar alguna guía en Internet cuando me he quedado bloqueado. Este juego no es para nada friendly, y aunque pasadas unas horas podrás desenvolverte mejor con sus mecánicas, vas a tener que pelear duro, tanto con la espada como con la cabeza, para poder escapar de Avernum.

-No está traducido al castellano. Es un juego con una cantidad ingente de texto, por lo que si te gusta leer y quieres empaparte de la historia de este mundo subterráneo, algo absolutamente necesario para disfrutar de esta aventura, más vale que te desenvuelvas con el inglés.

-Es imposible encontrar una cama libre en ninguna de las tabernas que se encuentran en las grandes ciudades de Avernum. El insomnio de mis personajes únicamente ha sido comparable al mío cuando esta joya me ha tenido enganchado hasta altas horas de la madrugada.

Conclusión: aunque se trate de una saga muy poco conocida, cualquier amante de los juegos de rol y de la fantasía épica debería probar este título. Siguiendo recomendaciones de Internet y, tras experimentarlo yo mismo, Avernum: Escape From The Pit es la mejor forma de acercarse a este mundo tan desconocido como fascinante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031328968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1575754065}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975735730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2209, 'last_played': 1465137177}
review:
[b]Nice try but not good enough[/b]

The skill system is very shallow and just a min-max thing within a few variables. Story and quest management is ok-ish but nothing special. Grafics... well see for your self. You may have dosbox games with the same or better look.
The controls are awful and clunky. Especially moving on the world map. Its a pain to steer a ship and your party because its so unprecise. Then you have the ui which is also annoying. For instance you open the inventory with a key but you cant close it with the same button wtf?! Then there are a lot of missclicks and unintentional clicks using menus like the inventory.

I mean for a very low sale price like 80% or more off its ok if you need smth for a couple hours if you're bored. But overall its a better deal to get dos box and play stuff like return to krondor. The characters are bleak in Avernum with most of the story feeling also very pale. The writing is not good enough to overcome the technical limitations. You might get a retro feeling playing this and remember good old rpg times from the early pc games. But thats about it. I really cant recommend it for having a decent rpg feeling. For retro feeling yes but tbh... meh!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091949345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1482883300}
review:
It is hard to review Avernum. How could I start it but saying that it is awful!
The graphics are horrible (but you get used to it), the animations are a joke (but you start imaginating better stuff), the interactions are plane (but still something)...
And yet, it is a true role playing game! And a good one (I swear!)!!
I won't lie: its story is not the best and the dialogues are so so but somhow you can play the game for a long time and have fun.
So give it a chance. You won't regret.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027178139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1481676412}
review:
I have not played Exile, or whatever the name is of the game that this is apparently a remake of. I am reviewing this game in isolation. That being said, the impression I get is that people seem to consider this game a "diamond in the rough", a game with poor publicity but surprisingly good gameplay given how unknown it is. As for me... well, all I can say is that I understand why this game is as obscure as it is.

Let's start with the atmosphere... the immersion, the feeling, the factor that makes any good RPG its salt. Avernum uses a very similar plot premise to a game I love, Gothic (a game that came out later than Exile, apparently - so Avernum did technically beat Gothic to the punch). An oppressive monarchy throws its criminals - as well as political opponents and anyone it just doesn't want around - into a sealed prison colony where they have to fend for themselves and struggle against each other as well as the wilderness down below. The difference is - where Gothic pulled this off flawlessly (and seriously - if you like Avernum's premise, and haven't played the Gothic games yet, try those out first), Avernum just fails to impress. It becomes obvious immediately as soon as you descend that the prison colony is actually an IMPROVEMENT over the Empire - prosperous, free, and the Empire's rule does not actually have any influence down there. That is a big no-no. It makes it hard to get into the shoes of your characters, who seem to be motivated by revenge or a desire to escape (depending on what conversation options you take as them), because one can't help but think... "okay, what's the conflict here? What's the big deal? Why don't I just settle down, become a mushroom farmer and have a happy life now that the Empire does not rule me?" 

Because that's a very valid question. Unlike in Gothic (where the prisoners are dependent upon the surface for luxury goods, weapons and other advanced items, and have to excavate ore in return), Avernum (the prison colony and the game's namesake) is utterly self-sufficient and does not have to give anything back to the Empire. Unlike in Gothic (where there are several camps all ruled by tyrants, the insane and other questionable figures, and there is danger both inside the camps and on the roads, where bandits lie in wait), most of the Avernum world is ruled by a rather unified monarchy with a just king at its helm and with the rule of law largely upheld. (Or so it still seems anyway, well into the midgame. If there is any shocking twist by the end, I know as little of it as you do. Wouldn't matter either way as far as the enjoyment of the story is concerned.) Avernum actually has its sub-prison colony, the Abyss, where the criminals of Avernum are thrown. Not exactly a very inspiring world, is it? Far from the gritty world of Gothic's penal colony, here you stroll almost freely between established towns, the only  enemies being the occasional cat people (sorry - they aren't bikini-clad babes, don't reflex-click the Buy button), snake people (same deal), and generic RPG monsters. Oh, and where Gothic had exciting, living, breathing characters, Avernum's characters are so incredibly dull and lacking any fantasy, it is almost an insult to the genre of Role-Playing Game. 

Seriously - I haven't completed the game, but I have played through a good chunk of it, I think. There is not a single interesting character that I met. Not even the King, nor any of his Mayors - all of them interact with your character in the same way. "Hello adventurer! Glad/not glad to see you. I love/hate mercenaries. We are fighting the cat/snake people here. I have a quest for you that involves either killing a lot of cat/snake people or retrieving a trinket guarded by cat/snake people. Or occasionally something else like a jelly or a drake, woo hoo!" Far from being an adventure, the gameplay feels like you are King Micah's head marshal, taking care of his endlessly boring errands throughout the realm, one after the other, never given a break or even an amusing distraction. (And let me just say: this doesn't just apply to the sidequests! Even the main quests themselves are just more of the same.)

Oh, of course, the game mechanics aren't stellar either. The combat system and the skill tree are nothing extraordinary, but at least they are serviceable... except for the horrible pathfinding system. There is no way to see whether your mage/archer is able to strike at the enemy from any given point. You have to click and hope for the best, then one of two things will happen: 1. your character attacks the target (woo hoo!) or 2. your character starts running around like a headless chicken, doing all kinds of crazy stuff, taking non-obvious paths, even attempting (and failing) to run all the way around the map to get at an enemy standing down a corridor (...why???). Nor are the line-of-sight mechanics intuitive - often you can attack when you shouldn't be able to, even more often you can't attack when you should be able to.

The interface isn't exactly great either. Aside from simply being old and dated, it isn't that informative either - there are a lot of weird things that can happen: for example, there is a mechanic that your mages cannot cast spells if they are too "encumbered", but either the game just doesn't mention this or it is way too easy to miss, same difference: being "encumbered" means not that your gear is too heavy, but that your to-hit chance is too low (...I know right, WTF?). This means, for example, that a +1 strength blade and no shield may leave your character unable to cast spells, but a heavier blade with no strength bonus (but a +5% to hit bonus) and a wooden shield (which doesn't have a to-hit malus) will let you do so. Beyond that, there are - of course - bugs. The game isn't riddled with them, but there are some - some traits don't work at all, for example.

While the big Spiderweb Software bundle may well be worth the price on sale (I don't know, haven't really tried much else from it yet), I can safely say I do not recommend Avernum: Escape from the Pit. If you get the bundle, try something else from it. Give this one a miss. It really isn't worth the hype. I'm sorry I couldn't finish it, but it was simply too much of a brutally boring slog - nonetheless, I hope that even my incomplete experience is enough to cast a convincing judgment... Avernum fails in the worst way an RPG can fail - it prioritizes quantity over quality and does not deliver much of the latter, it showcases how an RPG can go utterly wrong even before you take gameplay mechanics into account.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999858314', 'num_games_owned': 2397, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 6351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6302, 'last_played': 1480952599}
review:
You can actually see the casualization of the series: the most deep one is Exile escape from the pit where you had food management (you could die of starvation), a 6 members party, more weapon variation and a lot of spells.
Avernum 1 is more streamlined and simplified version in a good way: you have a simplified conversation mechanic (no need to guess the right word to type anymore like in Ultima or king's quest), most of the useful skills are still there but it lacks the 6 party people which gave you the option of specialization to each character (a swordsman,a spearman,a blunt weapon user, a rogue that uses ranged weapons, a mage and a priest) and tou had less spells.
Avernum escape from the pit is bad.....the story is still there (and it’s a good story!!....because it’s the same story for the 3rd time) but it dropped the skill system for a skill tree (why??), the food management aspect which gives more depth is gone (in Avernum 1 you had to be careful where you rest and in the second game where you took the journey to the Vahnatai lands you had to make stops in order to scavenge for food because you always lose some in the waterfalls), some of the useful skills like poisoning are gone, less weapon variation (no one handed spear, no rock throwing, no arrows, no clubs), even less spells, you cannot bash doors and alchemy? Forget it because you need to find alchemist in a town to do this for you and there are no recruitable NPCs...and death has no consequences because youer dead party members revive when entering a friendly town for free unlike in avernum 1 and exile where you had to pay a priest to revive them for a huge sum.
Exile is still my all-time favorite because of the RPG elements (but sadly I need to emulate win 3.1x to play this or get a windows XP machine), Avernum 1 is a very good remake and escape from the pit......no just no, it's bad compared to the originals - a real casualized version for phones and iPads.
If it would have kept the skill system and spells from Avernum 1 at least then I would have given it a good review but as it is…. it's too dumbed down compare to the other versions.
Play Avernum 1, you can still buy it on GOG (AVERNUM: THE COMPLETE SAGA)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079557727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1485323575}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016114126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1682223805}
review: This game is based off a classic and is just as much fun as when I played it 14 years ago. If you like RPGs with uniqueness, and that take time, planning, and preperation then you found the perfect game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191089310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1480341069}
review:
I have always loved the Avernum series, and IMHO, the best RPG ever made.
We can either follow the storyline or just go exploring , picking up one quest after another until we forget what's the main quest, which by the way can be easily traced back within our own pace since there is no pressure of time. 
The use of keyboard is somewhat frustrating, but you'll get used to it given a certain amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183956818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1485549372}
review:
A remake of the series that really got me into playing RPGs (Exile), just as fun as the original and a great deal for the money.


The thing that makes the game incredible is not fancy graphics or non-stop action but the story and the world, huge and surprisingly rich for an indie game. Throughout the series you will meet and talk to hundreds of characters, see the world change and develop and take part in the epic struggles that shape it all. 

I promise you'll become hooked and come to love the world of Avernum, just like I did many years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060666192', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1480260533}
review:
Игра мне не понравилась буквально после попадания в начальный город, выбор реплик мал и несоответствует напирмер с моим мнением представления ситуации. На 4к мониторе ничего не разглядеть, постоянно приходится через I(инвентарь) искать полезное имущество, система кражи тоже интерестна, во 2 городе на меня напали через стену. 
П.С. Наверное просто после Tyranny и Pillars of Eternity я зажрался.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274269751', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1694663432}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035448543', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1479936471}
review:
I like this game alot.
The graphics are a bit bland, but the story and gameplay make up for it.

All your partymembers are blank slates that you create at the beginning of the game (Or later in the game, you can delete a character and make a new one), so all dialogue and personality comes from npcs.

I don't really remember the music, but then I'm not really into music, and that might be good or bad depending. It's not like an epic battlescore, but it also doesn't make your ears start bleeding after 10 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159128973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3001, 'last_played': 1480136966}
review:
其实spiderweb的游戏我都很推荐，非常古典本质的rpg游戏，缺少酷炫画面的加成，纯粹靠剧情和游戏性来吸引玩家
Avernum系列游戏的文本量都很大，文笔不错，擅长气氛的刻画，从剧情描述和对话中可以获得很多关于世界观的信息
分支剧情最好玩，制作者将很多有意思的小故事作为任务穿插在游戏主线中
这些小故事很多是平常人的喜怒哀乐，有因为相恋而被放逐到地下、努力经营生活的同性恋人，有打情骂俏、和和美美的小夫妻，也有苦大仇深的种族纷争和复仇
这些丰富的支线从多个角度全面地刻画了一个复杂的地下世界，而不是只让玩家把目光放在逃出地下城的主线任务上
另外，没有固定的主角，玩家能够自由选择搭配队伍，这一点我也很喜欢
相比起有着完善背景和性格设定的固定主角（此类题材的主角，或者说玩家扮演的那个角色，通常会是异性恋男性），没有固定主角、自由组合的队伍虽然少了代入感，但是可以让人把更多精力放在战术搭配和世界观设定上
（而且不得不吐槽的一点是，如果玩家是女性或者非异性恋者，玩这种直男主角的游戏，有时候感觉不是一般的糟糕……想想有些游戏的感情线，you know what I mean）
总而言之，如果不是非3D会死星人，而且不反感大量英文文本内容，都可以尝试下这款游戏（或者这个制作公司的所有游戏），强烈推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198045350135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7746, 'last_played': 1356249600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989246181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1570348036}
review: 아주 오래된 게임, Exile의 두번째 리메이크. 1인개발사인 스파이더웹 소프트의 실질적 밥줄 중 하나이며 정말 전형적인 고전 RPG입니다. 소재도 좋지만 이전에 요구되었던 별놈의 해괴한 시스템들을 간략화하고 (좀 미묘하긴 해도) 그래픽화도 했다는 점이 좋군요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026458946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1597467694}
review:
As a fan of retro RPGs, I can think of few that take place in a world as expansive as Avernum.  I originally played it back when it was called Exile, before the revamp that gave it a tutorial level, made sure you couldn't leave the first town without knowing about the free supplies, updated the graphics (including work by Phil Foglio!), and dropped the party from six members down to four (the part I am saddest about; having a six-person custom party was sweeeeet).

The number of hours I spent exploring just the first portion of the game would be enough to fill a regular game by themselves.  Maybe it's just my play style, but I doubt you could get to the original's Shareware Demon if you weren't by that time ready to play through the rest of the game -- I still consider that the best form of shareware I've ever seen.

And the world-building within that area was astounding.  The idea of living in a giant cave, and how it would affect the citizens, was richly explored, down to the type of farming (mushrooms) and livestock (giant lizards).  The political in-fighting was interesting without being overbearing; it comments here and there on modern issues through the types of people who got tossed in the pit.  The monsters had some variety to them (not, perhaps, as much as more modern games) and the way the combat flows from the environment is really appealing (there's Fight and Peace states, but the fights happen within the place you're at, not in a separate screen).  There's a lot of loot, including bits of trash and such to make the world more immersive; there's little bits of story everywhere.  And although the character-customization options seem to have been streamlined (reduced), there's still plenty of ways to make a unique team.

If you're up for an old-school RPG with a very large world to explore, do give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025232316', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2171, 'last_played': 1698870408}
review: I played the original of this game, when it was the first "Exile" game, way back in the Nineties. This game is a remake of that game's remake. It's still as solid now as it was back then, with better graphics, easier interface, and new plot elements. This is as close to a tabletop gaming experience as you're going to find in today's modern video game world. Make your party and then decide where you want to go in your underground prison. Follow the plot line, or just explore. It's your call.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976839600', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1704248018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042381433', 'num_games_owned': 1196, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1531371598}
review:
[b]Avernum: Escape From the Pit[/b] is an old text-based CRPG with simple graphics and mechanics, that has been "enhanced" with new graphics and a better engine (still simple, though), along with a new name.

Personally, I thought this game was not worth my time, until I played it. This is the first Spiderweb Software I played, and I assure you it will not be the last. The game is so well written that I started playing older games from the authors (Geneforge), all because of text and fluff.

Gameplay is simple, with you directing a pre-defined party (chosen by you) around Avernum, the cavern-prison of the Empire. You get to places, get quests, fulfill them, get spells, items, and so on. You can modify your party at any time, and it even comes with a built-in character editor, in case you get stuck (due to poor ability planning) or bored.

What sets this game apart is that mostly everything is richly described, from the lowly blacksmith to the Temple of the Lizards (no spoilers), to the Crystal Cave. Give it a chance, and you will probably end up liking it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970718712', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1682045084}
review: A wonderful game full of choices and challenges. Hours of gameplay for meager cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049209567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6388, 'last_played': 1474680036}
review:
You want a throw back to the oldschool cRPG, then this is the place to go to. Avernum - an underground kingdom/prison the size of a small continent. Thrown down by the overlording surface empire, you must survive with your band of adventurers in this strange land.

Looking at the screenshots gives you a good idea of the look of the game. The writing, though, is probably the strongest feature about Avernum:Escape from the Pit. There is plenty of quick dialogue that forwards the story without becoming overwhelming. There are hundreds of differnet and unique characters to interact with.

One of my favorite aspects of the game is the level scaling... meaning, I feel it doesn't hold your hand as you adventure. Some dungeons are leveled well above your party. This means that at times you need to retreat and come back later. Learning which dungeons are hard is part of the fun, and challenge. I feel that modern games try to hand hold you too much, not allowing you to walk into an overpowered demon boss who promptly decides you are his next meal.

Avernum: Escape from the Pit brings back the old balance and fun of cRPGs. This game has been around since the 90s, first known as Exile: Escape from the Pit. It's got a great legacy and deserves attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008152219', 'num_games_owned': 957, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1750, 'last_played': 1578721750}
review: An amazing CRPG. If you loved Spider Web software's other titles, you'll love this one too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229231924', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 3891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3884, 'last_played': 1466623798}
review:
Avernum: Escape from the pit is a remake of the first game in the Avernum series. It is a grid, turn based CRPG with sandbox elements.

The plot is straight forward. On the surface there is the empire, ruled by the mad king hawthorn, a cruel dictator who rules with an iron fist. Those who go against the empire, or simply earn the ire of anyone in government, are tossed through a portal and left to die on the other side. The portal transports anyone who goes through it down to the depths of the planet, to a massive cave system with no hope of escape. So many people have been sent down there that they have begun to form their own nations as well, but, just because they are able to band together doesn't mean they are safe from the horrors that live down there with them. Your task as the newest exiles? Survive. Survive and do what you can for yourself, and for the underground nations.

Gameplay is easy to understand. Everything is done on a square grid, from exploring the overworld to navigating in combat. Each character has four core stats, followed by talents, then perks. Each core stat effects an aspect of your characters growth. Strength determines how hard you hit with melee weapons and your characters carrying capacity, dexterity determines how likely you are to dodge attacks and how accurate you are with weapons as well as how much damage you deal with ranged weapons, endurance determines how resistant you are to certain status effects and how much health you have, and finally, intelligence determines how much mana you have, how powerful your spells are, and how resistant you are to magic.

Every character has access to the exact same talent tree, allowing them to mix and match what skills they have to create whatever kind of character you want. Most of these talents are passive, but others grant active abilities which are worth investing into. You can put ten points into most talents, at which point you can't dump any more in, which is probably for the best considering at ten points in any skill, the bonuses are astounding. This really gives you the ability to build your own character however you want, from a long range crit machine, to a tank who casts spells.

Then there are the perks, which give minor buffs to certain things, but can also have a pretty big impact on your character depending on which ones you pick. If you use summons alot, you can get a perk that makes them stronger, or if you want to cast more elemental spells, get the perk which makes them work as if they were a level higher.

Combat works in terms of inititive, with the unit with the highest moving first, then the second highest going second and so on. Every unit has a set amount of time units to use during their turn, some actions costing more points than others. It might take one unit to move a single space, but ten to take an attack. You need to carefully position your characters and plan out what abilites your going to use on the many enemies you will encounter throughout your quests. 

Speaking of quests, you will encounter many on your travels, most of which are very fun. Granted, they can be as simple as "clear out the fort" or "bring me five bear asses", but few of the quests are exactly the same, and alot of them are actual, lengthy detours from the main quest lines. This really does help make the world feel that much more alive, which brings me to my next point.

Avernum is a rather bland game visually. There are a few interesting things to look at here and there, but for the most part, you are inside a huge cave, with fungus growing around you. Thankfully, you start the game off with a world map, and they went out of their way to design the terrain so that its destinctive enough to be able to navigate based on land marks, like a river or an odd rock formation. While every dungeon uses alot of the same textures (in fact, most of the game does), each one is very different, This is because they designed them in very different layouts, with a wide enough variety of enemies to keep things interesting. The game has no music though, or voice acting, so bring your own music.

With all this said, Avernum was an enjoyable experience for me, the only frustration i got was when i entered areas clearly too high a level for me or i missed that one hidden switch in the wall. The game does a great job of emulating the feeling of a Pen and Paper RPG, even allowing for player choice and, suprisingly, stupidity. It lets you ask really stupid questions, and the answers you'll normally get back can be equally as funny. I suppose thats what this game has, charm. While it isn't unique in terms of setting or has an overly deep, introspective, thought provoking plot. It does have alot of charm, a very well built combat system, a depressing, but hopeful and great plot, and a world that really inspires the desire to explore. The only limits are the walls of the cave. 

I would recommend this rpg to anyone who is a fan of old school rpgs, as well as people who enjoy newer things as well, as it has lots of familiar elements, while casting off some of the shackles older games have. If you are a fan of dungeons and dragons, or pathfinder, this is definitely an rpg you will enjoy, and possibly get some new ideas from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022079241', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1597573333}
review:
Le mec crée, développe et édite ses jeux depuis chez lui, avec sa femme.
Je sais qu'on est censés applaudir, "waaah j'en ferais pas autant" etc.
C'est super d'avoir des hobbies, de s'occuper à la maison.

Pour le joueur, c'est moins marrant : au choix, l'interface floue (mais à échelle correcte) ou nette (mais minuscule). Des graphismes vomitifs, des artworks indignes, pour un jeu qui part certainement d'une bonne intention, mais devrait tourner simplement dans la famille, gratuitement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002564646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1479489847}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090035210', 'num_games_owned': 2207, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1480050705}
review:
NEWエンジンによるAvernumシリーズ第一作目のリメイク作品で、あらすじの変更はないものの様々な改良と追加がなされている、らしい

とにかく文章量が半端ないので英語読めないと会話が終わらない無限ループに陥る（会話を終えるのにも「私が聞きたいことは以上です」などの選択をしなければならないため）

筆者は英語読めないので正直何も語ることはない

主人公達は囚人なのでキャラクターを作成する際のポートレートなど自由が効きやすいと言えよう
世界にはいくつかの勢力があり、中立を保ったり仲間として参入したり交戦したりと正に洋ゲ―といったロールプレイすることに主軸を置いているゲームである

筆者は英語読めないので正直何も語ることはない（二回目）

いかにも商売してそうな店のアイテムなどを盗んだりといった自由度はあるが険悪になるので覚悟しておくように

正直英語読めないとアイテムの売買すらわからないといった状況である

戦闘は初見殺しの死にゲーでF3キーでのクイックセーブをこまめに刻んだほうが安全である
ちなみにF4キーでクイックロードだ（入力ミス対策か2連続で押さないと発動しない）

筆者は英語読めないので正直何も語ることはない（三回目）

大事なことなので

author: {'steamid': '76561198016459500', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1646515196}
review:
Играл в игру на айпэде, но ревью напишу здесь. 
По скриншотам показалось что это древняя рпг для людей которые никак не могу перестать настольгировать по старым добрым временам, когда рпг были настоящими, пошаговыми и с душой. Я себя к таким людям не отношу, но игру всё-таки попробовал, и оказалось не зря.

Что понравилось:
- интересный мир с интересными персонажами. Авернум это такая тюрьма ссылка, соответственно люди сюда попадают с разными прошлым.
- хороший дизайн локаций. Я имею ввиду расстановки врагов и предметов. Любопытный всегда найдет себе награду если пробежится по всяким закоулкам.
- интересная карта мира. Тоже со всякими закоулками и неожиданными местами. Хорошо чувствуется ощущение от исследования этого нового мира.
- есть версия для планшета. Управление чуть менее удобнее чем на мышке, но зато можно играть лёжа на диване.

Что так-себе:
- бои. Они в общем-то не плохие, но под конец надоедают. Это скорее минус для второй части, как я понял там боевка точно такая же, а играть в неё я больше не хочу.
- по большей части сюжет линеен. То есть исследовать мир можно не линейно, но развилок в сюжете не предпологается.
- квесты решаются одним способом. Количество реплик в диалоге не меняется от интелекта или красноречия.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991330057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5431, 'last_played': 1478656139}
