author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13149, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 8457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7679, 'last_played': 1699469095}
review:
Addendum: As of Nov 2016, I nominated Avernum for the “I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award” Award.

Second remake of the classic Exile series' first part, Avernum: Escape From the Pit is classic roleplaying at its best! Basically, you play as a party of adventurers, who were exiled into a huge cavern, Avernum, far below the surface of the world. You have to find a new purpose here, which basically means doing all kinds of odd-jobs and quests for mayors, wizards and kings of the underworld and, while you're at it, trying to escape your dark prison.

The controls have been streamlined for the 2010s. Like in Avernum, the first remake, the game is still isometric and tile-based. However, you can finally control the characters efficiently with a mouse. This works splendidly, though the controls have frankly lost some of the function of the earlier games: e.g. you can no longer close doors (unless I've yet to discover how). Also, the pathfinding algorithm does some weird stuff sometimes when your preferred path is blocked, making characters run into wrong direction (and at worst, their DOOOOM). There's still no music (except in the title screen and the few cut scenes): use your favorite epic adventure music instead.

Skill system has basically been remade, though the comedic art of the skill descriptions has been appreciatively retained. Skills are now learned in trees, with a basic skill in the bottom and every subsequent skill requiring the below skills before they can be developed. Also, characters gain bonus traits every few levels gaining small bonuses to different skills and stats. It's a matter of taste if these are good or bad changes, but the whole works nevertheless quite fine.

Combat has always been a rather important part of Avernum series. Turn-based, the basics are still there. However, some additions and changes have been made. Warriors have gained special skills called battle disciplines to supplement their fighting ability, making them a bit more interesting and tactical than before. Spells have been remade as well since original Avernum. Particularly, all the blessings and curses have become area effects, and multi-hit spells are now cone or area attacks instead of simply hitting a number of targets.

Frankly, the hard-coreness of the series has dulled quite a bit with this latest installment. No longer are the dark dungeons truly dark, as you don't benefit from bringing a torch or casting light spells (which were actually removed altogether). There is no need to eat to satisfy hunger nor deal with dangerous diseases, and death is no longer so much a set-back as party is automatically resurrected and healed at a friendly town, removing the need for inns and renting rooms. You may no longer jump down ledges (which was never that healthy anyway). Identification of magical items has also been removed (albeit hilariously explained by "adventurers having better training nowadays"), and potion making has become a trade secret of alchemists, so your party can't learn it itself any longer. Spiders no longer say "hi!" in a high-pitched voice audibly. Along with these changes Avernum has lost part of its legacy and spark.

What is left, however, is an excellent RPG adventure in a unique fantasy world. The streamlining makes the game more accessible and lets the player concentrate on what's really important: dialogue, exploration and questing. And their implementation is simply brilliant. There are tens, if not hundreds, of characters in the game who all have their own dialogue trees, and several tens of dungeons and towns to explore, everyone of them extremely detailed. Enemies are still dangerous, and mini-bosses and bosses are refreshingly difficult to beat.

Game is not only high-quality, for there's also quite a lot of it. My first play-through, on Hard difficulty level, lasted about 80 hours. Want to just experience the story? Play on Normal or even Casual difficulty, and you may even change it mid-game. However, the highest difficulty level, Torment, provides an amply named challenge for an experienced player, requiring advance planning and lots of re-exploring in areas that were previously too dangerous. Seriously though, I recommend playing your first game on Hard difficulty at max, as Torment can get tedious if you don't know where to go for the next admissible challenge.

TL:DR?

Excellent dialogues.
Robust tactical combat.
Addicting exploration.
Epic questing to become true heroes.

Not convinced? You may as well give it a try.
The demo is available at http://www.avernum.com/avernum/index.html, letting you play through, I believe, about one third of the full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974361698', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7028, 'last_played': 1466737351}
review:
So I was buying software from Spiderweb Software back when things were on 3.5" floppies.  I remember writing a check and MAILING it in to the developer's address.  And then I was mailed back the codes.  In an envelope.

Sigh... it was so much nicer to get that rather than the credit card offers and bills that I get today.

Graphically I have to admit that the Exile series hasn't evolved a whole lot, particularly compared to other modern games.  But what has thankfully remained the same is everything else about the Exile series: the gameplay and plotlines.

At its heart this is a turn-based RPG, though with much more freedom to explore and build your characters than most other RPGs on the market.  Want to build a mage who also enjoys wielding a sword?  Yes you can do that.  Or a barbarian who dabbles in archery?  You can do that too.

Enemies and environments are varied enough to make the game interesting.  There are fairly few recolored enemies, and each town is distinct enough that they have their own personality and such.

It is easy to get lost in the cavernous world of Avernum, but I suppose that is part of the setting.

Overall well worth at least $8 in my book, and is usually much less expensive than that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052733311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3207, 'last_played': 1361865600}
review:
An old-school party-based turn-based open-world RPG.
Pros: immersive, huge world, great writing,unusual setting (underground prison), smart gameplay - always on your toes, branching storylines and several endings.
Cons: washed out palette, minimalistic sound, can be unfairly hard - even on 'casual' difficulty.
Length: ~30 hours rushing through, ~65 hours visiting everywhere.
Verdict: 6/10 overall, 9/10 in genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033235293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2336, 'last_played': 1600875688}
review: Classic Exile story in a modern engine. A fun time to play, though perhaps better suited to tablets in this modern era?

author: {'steamid': '76561197970241097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5530, 'last_played': 1366354800}
review: If you haven't played this game, you need to. This is an amazing accomplishment and just as exciting as it was in 1995 when I played Exile and Exile II! Well, well worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042890140', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2046, 'last_played': 1573517353}
review:
This is easily my absolute favorite game from Spiderweb Software.  The story and lore are pretty good, there's a good blend of seriousness and humor, the combat is fluid, and unlike Avadon, I actually find myself compelled to keep going the farther I get into the game.

A fair warning though, many of the bosses and minibosses are INCREDIBLY difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993154730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 15523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14679, 'last_played': 1369845705}
review: Play this game!  It has a wonderful grip on the world and a fantastic sense of exploration.  You never really know what you'll find when you set off into the caves, and the combat system is robust enough to stay interesting.  I cannot recommend it highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970532098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1385440911}
review: This is a great old school, party based, isometric RPG!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063013389', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 5297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1556147091}
review:
Superb old-school turn-based (W)RPG! I think it still holds a trophy with most of my hours spent on one game on Steam.
This is the remake of sorts from an award winning indie maker Jeff Vogel who actually made the game back during the 90es, but, for obvious reasons, the game needed to be updated to work with modern machines and OS', so after Jeff updated the engine starting from Avernum 4, he didn't want old game to be forgotten, so he rewrote the wole first game in new engine in 2011. 
It's fairly easy to see old genes still imbedded onto the game. Avernum: Escape from the pit is an Ultima style isometric turn-based RPG with unique skills and magic set into richly detailed fairly unique world with awesome, engaging writing and meticulously detaild maps. Narration and dialogues are the highlight, cause the game is old-school as it gets. No grim-brown realystic 3d graphic, no CGI cutscenes, but lovely prose with lots of charm and wit. Open ended world is one of the highlights. In theory you cn traverse the whole map, or at least most of it from the get-go, but areas do have unstated level requirement and you'll be quickly slaughtered if you go to the harder area than you'r level alows. Every city map is full of details, secret passages and metroid-esque still unreachable places, so don't expect to be 100% through with even the most basic of dungeons or cities up till the very end. Level progression is smooth and T-B combad is addictive in that ancient pokemon/Xcom/Fallout1&2 kind of way. 
So all in all, not to stretch this for too long, I'd warmly recommend the game for anyone wanting nice, solid T-B WRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002339199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1616635299}
review:
Geniales Rollenspiel im Retro Look,sehr Textlastig,wodurch sich eine enorme Athmosphäre aufbaut.

Erinnert sehr an die alten Ultima Teile,oder auch Icewind Dale,Baldurs Gate etc.

Große,schöne spielwelt mit stunden an Quests,ausgereiftem,rundenbarsiertem Kampfsystem sowie funktionierendem Zaubersystem.

Dies spricht ebenfalls für die anderen Spiele des Entwicklers,welcher sich seit 1994 der Entwicklung von Rollenspielen auf Shareware,und mittlerweile Indie Spielen verschrieben hat.

In der heutigen Zeit noch Fantastische Rollenspiel Sagas spielen zu können,wie sie damals auch entstanden sind ist genial,ein Großteil der heutigen Rpg's wird in Jahren nicht dieses Spielgefühl hervorrufen können.

Man sollte jedoch unbedingt gute Englisch Kenntnisse mitbringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038398436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5316, 'last_played': 1562253102}
review: Отличная пошаговая инди-РПГ с интересным открытым миром для исследования. Из особых плюсов - возможность запуска на совсем уж древних ПК.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025376643', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 8474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1702667558}
review:
Old style RPG the likes that seldom appear in games these days.... Perhaps too old?   

It feels too "pre-Diablo" and is complex... Good game, just dated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038129117', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 6248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2000, 'last_played': 1381028298}
review: I like this more than I should. Hours gone by in what feels like minutes, which is ironic for something with such slow gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086790878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1586104345}
review: I've been playing Spiderweb's games since I was just a little kid. It got me into RPG games. I hope to still be playing this company's games when I'm in a space retirement home on Mars. Easily recommended for anybody that wants to truly lose themselves in an immersive world with a rich, complex, and entertaining backstory with classic old-school PC RPG mechanics. Snatch it, grab it, learn it, love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072704247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4255, 'last_played': 1527374026}
review: Great roleplaying, nice story, nice writing, interesting world, free roaming exploration, no level capping, no level scalling. Awesome game for it's price tag. And huge. I've spent over 60 hours in one playthrough withouth doing everything there is to do. If you are into roleplaying and don't mind the graphics, try this game. Now. Seriously. And you don't even have to buy it just to make up your mind. The developer offers a very big demo for you to see if it's really for you, and what's more, once you decide to buy, you can keep playing from where you left of on the demo. So there is no excuse for not trying, just don't let the overly simple (by todays standards) graphics scare you. This game is a jewel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989078937', 'num_games_owned': 2466, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 10561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9810, 'last_played': 1375455761}
review: Awesome game, this is pretty much a western Dragon Quest. An original setting, good combat and character customization and an amazing game world, open to explore at your own pace and offering an enormous amount of content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027944070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2961, 'last_played': 1375138404}
review: Classic adventuring with all the right graphical updates so that your eyes don't bleed :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198045359528', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1378258203}
review: There is only one thing you need to know to want this game: there is a cave full of happy talking spiders, all of them named Spider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025339322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1442095251}
review: This is a great older game with content that just goes on and on pulling you into a deep and immersive story. Seriously, give this game a try

author: {'steamid': '76561198011954633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3023, 'last_played': 1501884740}
review: I love this game as I loved Exiles and Avernums before and this is a great remake. If you're into old school RPG you owe it to yourself to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072253629', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1511839430}
review: superb

author: {'steamid': '76561198046730114', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7086, 'last_played': 1367910000}
review:
At first it looks old-school but it plays modern. I liked this game even a little bit more than Avadon because of more freedom and the noticeable level of difficulty. 
For this price it is a great game with about 80h playtime. I give it 8.5 points out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095245395', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5273, 'last_played': 1438525205}
review:
The new version (formerly Avernum and Exile) looks more appealing than ever.

The character development system is new (the same system from Avadon) so you can try new gameplay styles. The graphic update, while may not seem as much, is pleasant. The story is has been refined since it was first told but it is still very much an enjoyable Jeff Vogel story at its core.

If you played any of the older incarnations of this you may want to give this new version a go even if just for the nostalgia factor. What I really would like to see is the remake of Avernum 3.

I highly recommend checking SpiderWeb's other games at: http://www.spidweb.com/

author: {'steamid': '76561198001072155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4568, 'last_played': 1646599551}
review:
This is a remake of the original Avernum which was itself a remake of the Exile series so it's not exactly an original game. On the other hand the game itself is worthy of a remake. The story is a lot of fun, and the setting is fascinating. The game has a good mix of main quests and side quests and indeed you'll probably spend a lot of time wondering around doing side quests before you even find the main quests. On the subject of main quests there are actually three different main quest lines which can be completed independently of each other.

In terms of mechanics this remake is staying reasonably true to the original. The stupid single map thing they had in Avernum 4-6 is gone and it's back to the traditional split between overland travel and town/dungoen maps. The skill system has been simplified somewhat but the addition of Battle Disiplines for fighters more than makes up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968471939', 'num_games_owned': 1978, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1650795379}
review: Great old-school RPG! Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033473318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3552, 'last_played': 1384731081}
review: Good pacing, challenging combat, works under wine!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966400027', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2553, 'last_played': 1546047971}
review:
A classic-styled RPG with a few unobtrusive modern implementations. If you like immersing yourself in a slow-paced story and light strategy, this is the game for you. Try the demo first.

As a warning, if you've played the past Avernum game or Exile, the narrative is more or less the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014493471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1425571564}
review: It's a travesty that this isn't more popular. I enjoyed this game a hell of a lot more than I enjoy most modern RPGs. It's a game that has an in-depth story, lore, and interesting side quests, characters, and world interaction, all without sacrificing a whit of the classic style of gameplay, and it's tough as well, even on normal difficulty. An RPG gem that you really have little excuse to pass on, especially for only $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027009156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1720, 'last_played': 1656593794}
review: Not a game for everyone but if like me you are super into oldschool CRPG's then you will tottaly love this game! Create 1-4 characters and exsplore the underground world of avernum, and there is a lot to exsplore :3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026932320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1368860400}
review: Gameplay and story more than make up for ancient graphics.  Hard to get into, but even harder to get out of once you're enthralled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031789432', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 3670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1423896548}
review: If you like old-school PC RPGs and aren't deterred by games not having the best graphics EVAR, this is the game for you. They've crafted an excellent setting and filled it with plenty to do. And it's cheap. I recommend this game strongly. I've put a lot of hours into it and am nowhere near finishing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062229816', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1369206000}
review: Highly Recommended, This game is a remake of the classic "Exile - Escape from the pit

author: {'steamid': '76561198005420607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1365231600}
review:
Офигенная игра.  Немало текста (не Тормент, конечно, но…), интересные бои (надо думать и пробовать по-разному), чумовая изометрическая графика (образца 98-го года, Фоллаут, правда, с большей любовью прорисован). Воровство, как всегда, очень помогает. Юмор присутствует местами :) Система развития персонажей немного странная, а мож и нет, я не понял.

Начинал играть уже раз пять, забрасывал, возвращался. Куча неизвестных слов на английском, приходится по контексту догадываться, тяжело, но интересно.

Играюсь, правда, на айпаде :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039797647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8147, 'last_played': 1363330800}
review: If you liked Baldur's Gate, X-Com or Fallout you're likely to get into this retro RPG. While there are some rough edges, if you persevere you'll be treated to a really well written story with great pacing, characters and twists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043227868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1364540400}
review: I bought this on the strength of the reviews, despite some apprehension about the graphics.     Other role-players were right; this is a really engaging RPG with a great campaign setting, free roaming environment, good mechanics and addictive battles.  I was also able to overide the character portraits in the directory with some fantasy art I liked to make the characters I wanted.  I'm playing on hard difficultly which feels about right.  Anyway got to get back to my campaign to bring justice to Avernum...!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999823834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1361088000}
review:
Only for the hardcorest of the hardcore turn-based strategy lovers. I have played Suikoden I and II from start to finish, Tactics Ogre, Suikoden Tactics, and Final Fantasy Tactics 3 times, plus both GBA games and the PSP remake as well. Not to mention Civilizations I-V. I LOVE turn-based strategy, in all of its forms. 

Or so I thought. 

This game is a member of a disturbingly expansive group of titles I like to call Keep Away Games. Remember the old childhood game keep away, where the whole point was to keep a certain person from getting a certain item they really wanted? This is similar, in that the fun is always kept JUUUUUUST outside your grasp. Ok, that's not true. Sometimes it flies so far over your head that the Sun blinds you, and you lose track of it completely.

-Just when you're enjoying exploring the overworld, your characters get stuck because you're trying to click on the square next to you, but the game thinks you're clicking on you. Teeth starting to grate, CHECK.
-Just when you're enjoying combat, you click to move 2 squares away, and the idiotic AI decides you meant you want to take 4 turns walking completely around the level, taking the absolute most circuitous route possible to get to your destination, rather than move TWO FREAKING STEPS IN THE OTHER DIRECTION. Bonus points if this idiocy costs you a battle. Prepare for lots of bonus points. Swearing at computer in multiple languages, CHECK CHECK.
-Just when you've gotten a few dozen rounds of combat down and are feeling good about things, you hit a battle so ridiculously tough (in the same exact area you've been cleaning up) that you have to quicksave and quickload 3 dozen times, hoping to get an outcome where your entire party isn't stunned at the same time for the 3rd turn in a row again. Clicking on "Delete Local Content," oh 10 minutes ago called to give you your CHECK.

I would like to meet the person whose idea of fun is fighting 3 enemies, each of which can stun your entire group at once and summon other monsters to help, which each take 4-5 turns of your team's entire concentrated effort to kill, so that I can tattoo across their forehead in Helvetica bold "FAULTY GENETIC CODE. DO NOT SLEEP WITH."

Controls are hideous as well. You can control the whole game via keyboard, and absolutely 165% should, but even that isn't well fleshed out. Hitting I opens up the inventory, of course, but DON'T hit I again. You have to hit ESC to close the menu. Hitting I again may accidentally use the item in your inventory to which the I key got arbitrarily assigned to. Small things like that really don't make that big of a difference, but they certainly don't help a game that already left a sour taste in my mouth.

Games like this actually make me angry, because they have the potential to be SO. AWESOME. Idiotic controls, horrifically moronic AI, COMPLETE lack of direction, and stupefying difficulty spikes aside, you may enjoy this...

...if you're trapped on a desert island, or don't have enough money to afford aaaaaaaaanything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985998458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3216, 'last_played': 1336460400}
review:
Avernum is an interesting game that is reminiscent of the RPGs from the 90s.  While the graphics aren't really there, the gameplay is pretty addicting and well worth the few bucks that I paid.

There is a lot of traveling and exploration, with all sort of quests that require you to think a bit.  However, the puzzles are easy to figure out and offer great rewards.  The combat is pretty fun and simple.  

This isn't anything spectacularly revolutionary, but it was a cheap thrill for me and I enjoyed it till the end without feeling as I was expecting more from it.  It is what it is: A simple RPG without any extra flair or new feature. I can honestly say that I had gotten more than my hours worth, exploring the underground kingdom for all sorts of lost treasure and whatnot.


Rating: 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1641926120}
review:
Great RPG! While the graphics are dated, the gameplay and depth is rich. A lot of RPG's claim to be open ended where you get to choose your own path, but Avernum: Escape from the Pit is the only RPG I've ever received that feeling from.

To those who explore and talk to the inhabitants of Avernum, you'll find that this game is rich with lore. The lore may not be as deep as the Mass Effect series, but it's still deep, and presented as if you were in the hero's shoes.

If you're looking for an RPG with depth and a great story, Avernum is a must play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976741516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1680822126}
review:
I'm an old-school gamer from the time when characters on the screen were represented by simple symbols and squiggly lines. To draw people in to play the games back then the games had to be either utterly fun or have a great story. Games like Ultima IV were like that, utterly horrible looking but so deep you could play through it ten times and still not find eveything the game had to offer.

"Avernum: Escape from the Pit" [AEftP] is just like that...
Except that the graphics are actually fairly good. 

This is a HUGE roleplaying game with so much ground to cover that you at first don't know what to do or where to go. As you start the game you're free to explore everything and everywhere, even places that will get you killed instantly.
The game relies heavily descriptions and dialogue, so if you're afraid of reading this game might not be for you. However, if you DO like to read you'll find a game with great storytelling, a good combat system, and more content than you can burn through in a month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019826070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3531, 'last_played': 1358668800}
review: The badass gameplay we'd expect from Spiderweb, plus a pretty cool setting and a little bit of humour here and there. Control and AI pathfinding can be a little finicky sometimes, but this is still a great game if you like old-school-style RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961891217', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 4812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4762, 'last_played': 1468933546}
review: A refreshed and recoded version of the fascinating 1995 indie RPG hit Exile: Escape From the Pit. If you enjoy exploration, turn-based strategic combat, and classic RPGs, this is definitely a great investment for the price. It is classic in the sense that it is highly dialogue and lore-driven, allowing for a large imaginative world filled with legends, myth and discovery. Avernum, much like it's source material, still has an impressive world map and environment to explore with hidden or special encounters for the curious.  Considering you can also purchase an iPad version of Avernum (available on the App store), it would make a great mobile RPG for those long commutes / trips. Recommended if you don't mind simpler graphics and a decent amount of reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996887338', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2688, 'last_played': 1342076400}
review:
A remake of a remake of Exile, an indie RPG from the 1990s that was developed first for the Mac. This is actually a decent 2D story-driven exploration RPG in the vein of Ultima. The story (or at least setting) is original, which makes it stand out enough that I played it a lot longer than Avadon (another recent Spiderweb RPG) before getting distracted by other games.

My only complaint is that the author doesn't know to put a one millisecond sleep call in his main game loops, so be prepared for having one of your CPU cores pegged at 100% usage while playing (which is especially frustrating on laptops, where power usage and heat dissipation / fan noise are concerns). This is a ridiculous oversight for a 2D game that is not heavy on the system requirements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998745818', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4503, 'last_played': 1374374300}
review: Nostalgia caught me with this one, growing up with the Exile series I was addicted to the RPG mechanics of table-top style turn-based games. This latest remake of Avernum lives up to it predecessors in every way. The story telling is far superior and the combat is more streamlined. Overall one of the greatest indie RPGs of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991952668', 'num_games_owned': 4844, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 8406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8406, 'last_played': 1345446000}
review:
A remake of a remake, and made by Spiderweb Software known for making solid RPG games, this game has everything it takes to drag turn based RPGs into the twnty-first century. A vast world to explore, tons of people to meet, monsters to slay and quests to complete. All in all, an epic adventure!

For providing over 100 hours of solid fun, I give it three dragons out of four.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992234603', 'num_games_owned': 1797, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1350284400}
review: This is the 3rd time this game has been released. Originally made in 1995, then re-released in 2000, Avernum is the effort of one man. This game excels at turn-based combat. It reminds me very much of RPG games before Diablo was considered a RPG. Top-down, party management with a good story line and some interesting characters along the way. Avernum has actually gotten better with age. A definate must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7431, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 3144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3144, 'last_played': 1348642800}
review:
This is what every open-world RPG should be. Straight the fuck up.

There are no classes. You make 4 people, as little or as much as you like to customize them pre-game, and you get chucked underground because you pissed off someone in The Empire. You aren't coming back from underground, not anytime soon. You get a crude map and a tip that if you're as pissed off as you look, go visit a mage to the west. She's pissed too.

But you don't have to be pissed. Maybe you want to explore. (The more map you cover, the more XP you get for finding new locations.) Or that place called "Tower of the Magi" sounds handy, learn some spells. Perhaps go on a pilgrimage from town to town earning priestly skills from the preachers. You can steal like mad if you want. Nothing's nailed down. Just don't get seen. And maybe you just like the thought of being king of the underground? There's a crown out there. Kill the dude wearing it and park your ass on the throne.

I have yet to see this game tell me "no".

author: {'steamid': '76561197970307991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 3546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3546, 'last_played': 1345359600}
review:
Retro game that was quite a bit of fun, actually.  Not visually stimulating, but well-written for the most part, with some solid gameplay mechanics and some interesting and convenient ideas of its own.  Has a few annoying puzzle gimmicks that it will throw at you more than once, and puzzles are not exceptionally clever.  Still, the game was very good and very long for the cost.

I'd say my only real complaint is the utter lack of a musical soundtrack.  I guess that was for ambiance?  It works alright, for the most part, but I think the game could have been much improved with a decent background soundtrack.

Be warned, the game does not always provide you with a lot of direction, and is merciless if you happen to wander into an area that is too strong for you.  It will take a bit of trial and error to figure out exactly where you're strong enough to wander, at least at first.  The margin for error widens as your party gains strength toward the middle of the game, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3184, 'num_reviews': 456, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4687, 'last_played': 1349161200}
review:
A very fun and basic RPG of sorts with many interesting ideas.

Okay, here's the set up. The world is being oppressed by the empire and people who commit crimes get thrown into a one-way portal that leads into a underworld deep beneath the ground. You start with a group of 4 people (of different classes and looks you can change)  who were all thrown down here in this hellhole, but you soon learn that this prison thrives with cities and villages, however there are of course many monsters that make like down in Avernum difficult.

You have Goblins, Niphilim (cat people), Ogres, Dragons, Giant Vermin, humans and many, many more threats making life in Avernum hell. I highly recommend this game for anyone who is a fan of RPGs. It's pretty open with you being allowed to hunt down and kill whatever you like in case you want to kill monsters and steal their loot or kill the townsfolk and steal their loot, though you won't get any quests from them.

review:
I have to say on this: no school like the old school....

Through the years, I have managed to play all of Jeff Vogel's work....the avernum/exile games, geneforge games, etc.....and I have to say this is one of the few series in all of gaming that I have enjoyed every iteration.  Avernum's writing is top notch, with seriously funny moments, and i would recommend not just this game, but the whole collection to anyone.

review: This is a remake of a shareware classic from the 1990s.  It is a tactical, story-driven RPG that is unforgiving and expansive.  Even late in the game it is possible to find moments where your party is slain within seconds IF you're not careful.  It makes surviving and coming out on top all the more rewarding because it is not guaranteed here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042305419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1658549977}
review: Avernum really harkens back to the days where games couldn't rely on graphics to sell, so instead, they put all their focus on gameplay and storytelling. Avernum's huge sandbox world that changes dependent on your party's actions is a huge draw, and the customization of your characters' abilities will leave you with tons of options on how to play the game. This is a remake of an older Windows game that I played nearly 15 years ago, and it's only gotten better with its age.

review: The original Exile Escape from the PIt was easily my favourite game when I was a kid.  You need to be willing to play it slow, but it is a real gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988184826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4670, 'last_played': 1496478183}
review:
Exile, as it was known in the early and mid 90's, and its remake, Avernum. 
An excellent plot, a vivid and imaginative world and the feeling of exploring ancient underworld locations untrodden by anyone for centuries, or even millennia are enough to captivate anyone who considers themselves a fan of "western-styled" role-playing games. This "remake of a remake" brings the series in full glory to the era of online distribution, for far cheaper than many "big name" competitors..
Actually, just.. play it. 
Jeff and his people have done such a great job, once again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051570103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4745, 'last_played': 1366527600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023822431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1510923324}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050778778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1636004627}
review: So ridiculously addictive and fun. It's totally perfect for people wanting to play old school rpgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997812791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2743, 'last_played': 1335942000}
review:
Second remake to the first game in one of my favorite game series of all time! Ages ago I pirated them when I was a kid with no credit card, so paying money for this felt so good. ^^

This is at its core a very old school RPG with lots to see, do, talk to and/or kill. The sense of exploration is surpassed by very few games and the writing is great. The setting is basically an even larger (and MUCH deeper) version of Blackreach from Skyrim that is used as a penal colony by the tyrannical Empire that controls the surface world. The game does very little of telling you where to go, but there are 3 main quests that you will eventually find a trail to.

Combat is admittedly kinda annoying at times. Don't play on hard because the enemies will have way too much hp and you'll just get frustrated. Have one character by a healer and KEEP THEM SAFE. Anyhows, super-recommended to anyone who ever liked old RPGs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000305114', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 4097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1372295645}
review:
Countless hours can be sunk into this game. Classic old school RPG epic, teeming with nooks and crannies to sink your teeth into.

Between cheats, difficulty adjustment, balance, and a straight up character editor, there's no way this game will be ultimately too hard for you to beat. Lots of reading though. That could be good or bad depending on your view point. The writing is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004285507', 'num_games_owned': 1201, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4319, 'last_played': 1392715024}
review:
good old school RPG 
from a 3man company called spiderweb, they got few great games 
The story and writing is good. The world is really big and open.
It's really a sense of freedom since you can move around all you want, stopped only 
by the level of the monsters and npcs 
It's a turn based PRG, with all the elements you might spect on this type of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052587472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1604804489}
review: A fantastic reimagining of Spiderweb Software's first game, "Exile: Escape from the Pit". Well worth the price tag. Fun to play, a very good length with hundreds of quests, and with some of the best writing I've ever seen in a videogame. A+++

author: {'steamid': '76561197977767351', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 8685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8673, 'last_played': 1561700571}
review: Awesome open world, party focused, turn based RPG.  It has some of the usual flaws that come with most Spiderweb games: slightly cumbersome interface at times, a few too many trash mobs (which can become a tad annoying late game once you no longer need the experience for leveling) and the harder difficulties require a large amount of min/maxing to get by (which isn't a big deal on lower difficulties, but if you play on torment hybrid builds are basically ruled out if you want to survive).  But apart from these minor quibbles (and they are minor) this is really one of the better open world RPGs I've played in ages.  The world is massive and packed with detail so basically every nook and cranny has something to make it worth exploring, without any of the "generic algorithm generated" feeling you get from many open world games.  Well worth the 10 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981087625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1379415369}
review: If your a fan of turned based strategy games this can be a fun time.  Brings back the good ol days of rpging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967223692', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 2990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2881, 'last_played': 1424618511}
review: A great remake of the original series, but like all Spiderweb games, make sure to leave your sanity at the door.  The quests bug up so easily, making this amazing game hard to play to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037960452', 'num_games_owned': 3950, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 5896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3650, 'last_played': 1426428118}
review: Огромный мир, море квестов и неплохой challenge - что еще надо для поклонника олдскула? Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057358795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 7601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7601, 'last_played': 1337065200}
review: It's retro!....it's big!....the story line is well written and the micro character building impressing. If you like turned based role playing games and you don't give a damn about visuals but you do like your games to be involving, smart and the way they did it when games where just mind blowing and addictive....don't look no futher. Avernum is  THE GAME!  I'm not kidding. I am a hard core gamer and doing it for more than 25 years. Avernum is hot in it's own way! And hey!!!  I've played Skyrim, Mass Effect...you name it...I love it!!  As far as I'm concerned Avernum is up there in the Best Games Ever! And it takes up about 168 mb of hard disc space. Give it a try and play it. You will be an addict within an hour.....if you'll have a creative mind and are a smart guy/girl.....promise.  : )    Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993460712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3292, 'last_played': 1579303563}
review: Pretty good overall. It's a little like Skyrim - large world and generally short quest lines. It's also graphically archaic, with a lot of the flavour being supplied by text descriptions, and the interface is a bit clunky. There's no steam demo but there is a fairly extensive demo on the Spiderweb website.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994101560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1414836654}
review: 'tis good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985836415', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 4091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4091, 'last_played': 1336374000}
review: Nice oldschool RPG/adventure. The writing seems to be well done, so far. Worth a try for it's price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980179343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2517, 'last_played': 1518229607}
review: If you like old school 90's WRPGs, and aren't too picky about graphics, this is for you. Challenging grid-based and tactical gameplay alongside an (admittedly very wordy...) plot made for an experience that I greatly enjoyed. If you don't like reading, though, it may not be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960526605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1334473200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994218017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3975, 'last_played': 1686342660}
review: This game is the opposite of Skyrim.  Crappy sound and decades old graphics with amazing traditional RPG gameplay and a very complelling game world.  Well worth it for the nostalgia of 90s gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019683734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1499523366}
review: I was soo happy when I saw this on sale. A great game that I thought I would never see on steam because it was just too good. Although you can't play as the nephilim or slithzerikai like in prevous versions of the game, which is a bit sad as those races were really fun to play and beats playing as a human any day. Still a good remake of a classic game though, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037418418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3811, 'last_played': 1464126042}

Great RPG. Been a fan since 1994 :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198019046323', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1450373252}
review:
Great game.  Sure the graphics are quite dated, but I enjoy their charm.  As long as you enjoy very deep and sometimes unforgiving RPGs this is a must have. Character building is top notch and combat is strategic and engaging..  This version of the series is GREAT because it includes an in-game character editor/trainer.. So if you get to the late game and realize one of your party members is sub-par you can cheat and edit them a bit.. Which of course some purists would never do, but it does allow the gamer with little time on their hands to have a good time at such an unforgiving franchise.  If you do end up getting it, this link is a MUST read before playing..

http://www.spiderwebforums.com/forum/ubbthreads.php?ubb=showflat&Number=252853#Post252853

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998279727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1593819854}
review: I remember playing the original version of this game, Exile, when I was a little kid, back when Shareware was still a thing. The game  has been redone, but is still the addicting, sprawling epic old school RPG that I loved then,and still love now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967782814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3630, 'last_played': 1620228498}
review: Simple story, massive game. A game of exploration, questing, and tactical combat! If you like old school RPGs, this one's a good one! The second and third games of this series will be coming soon, hopefully!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998851504', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1929, 'last_played': 1400638047}
review:
Spiderweb Software (making games since 1994) revisits once again their 1994 classic with this second ground up remake. 

You have been cast into Avernum, a pit deep under the surface of the planet, where the maleovent empire of the surface throws literally anyone they deem undesirable. Explore the vast cave network, Slay monsters, visit dungeons, get loot and save Avernum!

I played the first sequel to the original Exile 2: Crystal Souls, (which got 1995's shareware game of the year award) having finally played this polished version of Escape from the pit I can say with certainty that this game is a must have to any RPG fan that loves tactical open adventures!

And with a price like $10 bucks how can you lose?!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970257956', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3466, 'last_played': 1517882092}
review: If you're a fan of old-school RPGs, you really can't go wrong with this. Especially for $8.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014932529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2154, 'last_played': 1577226401}
review: very cool old school rpg, perfect for ppl used to campaigns in underdark and undermountain

author: {'steamid': '76561197971074683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1335250800}
review: Classic turn based open world adventure.  Great game

author: {'steamid': '76561197977153856', 'num_games_owned': 4887, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1468295889}
review: Yes, this is the second remake of the classic Spiderweb Software RPG that started the whole ball rolling, Exile: Escape from the Pit. So if you've played either previous version, there's new content but you may well find it overfamiliar. That said, people new to this particular franchise should absolutely jump in here. It has all the glorious unfettered exploration of that vast underground cavern and the hard-bitten criminals and political dissidents that fight to survive it that made the previous editions so good, but with significant graphical improvements, a more modern interface and design, certain conveniences, and of course achievements. Also, it's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008307157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4056, 'last_played': 1402565137}
review: Just buy the original Avernum, I think. At least in that one there's ammo and closable doors.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966248112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1334732400}
review:
Avernum comes back from the grave as a remake to a remake by using Avadon's engine, and adding some new content that wasn't in the previous old remake.

You have a group of four people, sentenced to Avernum for crimes against the crown, perhaps they stole something or they may have looked at the emperor funny or they just didn't fit in, despite this, they're chucked into a portal, never to return.

In comparison to the older Avernum, they've made changes, lots of them, skills are distributed via talents, and custom characters get fewer stat points, but you level up faster and there's even a tutorial, how nice of them! It's still quite lengthy, though, but less confusing.

Combat plays out like a tactical RPG, move your characters, cast spells and such. It's worth a look, there's a demo on their site if you're unsure.

One last thing: Giant, Friendly, Intelligent, Talking Spiders. That's all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998311341', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1339311600}
review: Great game if you're looking for some turn based dungeon crawling nostalgia, or if you're just looking for an in-depth fantasy RPG for under 10 bucks. What it lacks in cutting edge graphics and SFX it more than makes up for in gameplay and storyline. If you love D&D style games, I highly recommend this. Spiderweb software = awesome software!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006488265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1413098006}
review: Remake of a remake of one of my favouite rpg games of all time: Exile: Escape From the Pit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971572722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1709320722}
review: I've been a fan of Spiderweb's RPGs since I played Exile and Exile 2 on my old Mac IIsi back in the 90s, and wow, they're still trucking. Simplistic and somehow naìve, yet endlessly deep and full of interesting stories, these games are perfect netbook companions, or just nice clicky RPG adventures for rainy days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007204626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1363503600}
review: Love it. Can't wait for episodes 2-6 (Mostly 3)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976784669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1334905200}
review:
What can I say, I love Spiderweb Software.

If you love, old school, text heavy games, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963976505', 'num_games_owned': 1738, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1334646000}
review: Avernum is the redesign of the original Exile series by Spiderweb Software. It is an amazing game with rich story resulting in countless hours of gameplay. The system is built around old classics like Baldur's Gate, it offers a strategic element to play which varies widely by what you choose. The hard stats and skills have been redesigned from the original series to offer new stat trees to the gameplay allowing for character customization. Overall I recommend this game to any old school RPG fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976581199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4494, 'last_played': 1559020949}
review:
Avernum was one of the staples of my childhood. While I admit that games like this are almost exclusively niche appeal, Avernum has a deep enthralling world that was the first of the RPG genre to really bring me in. There's lore everywhere, and in a game where the top down setting would get in the way of that, it actually shines here. The world feels real despite not being first or third person, couple that with cool battles, spells, enemies, skills, and of course, sweet loot, makes Avernum quite a good series. 

If you've never liked RPGs or games of this top down turn based genre before, however, this will not change your mind.
